Mays si contrarietat es a la egrecio de l’aygua en aquela hora tu perforas aquela: e aquo no es fayt sino per aquo quar le pannicol blanc en le orrifici de la plagua fa contrarietat e prohibeys le eyssiment de l’aygua, lahoras cove que tu metas en la plagua pena o instrument am la qual es extrayta l’aygua dels ydropitz, la forma del qual es precedida; o ajusta en la opprecio de la plagua un petit.	But if there is resistance to the drainage of the water, at that time you should perforate it: and this is done only because the white pannicle in the opening of the wound creates resistance and prevents the exit of the water; then you should put into the wound a probe or instrument with which water is extracted from dropsies, the form of which is described before; or apply a small pressure to the opening of the wound.
E sapias que l’aygua retorna, e es agueguada aprop vi meses o enaviro aquels; e cum es agreguada, lahoras sia perforat segon aquela meteyssa manieyra, quar le malaute ayssi passara les sieus dias.	And know that if the water returns and is collected again within six months or thereabouts; and when it is collected, then it should be perforated in the same manner, for the patient will thus pass his days.
Capitol .lxiii.	Chapter 63.
De seccio sobre hernia carnosa e la curacio de lu.	Concerning the incision of a fleshy hernia and its treatment.
Sapias que en la seccio sobre aquesta hernia es temor perdusent a pernicia en las majors disposicios; per que a mi es vista la dimissio de lu e esser salvat per aquela milhor.	Know that in the incision of this hernia there is danger leading to death in most cases; therefore, in my view, its removal and being saved by that [method] is better.
E yeu so rememorant la operacio en aquela e las specias dels apostemas.	And I am remembering the operation on that and the types of abscesses.
Donc, dic que l‘apostemas natz en les cos dels quals les genetius so conponutz e es fayt aquo per motas causas: o per superfluitat aguda agra, la qual es efundida als genetius, o per percuscio.	Therefore, I say that abscesses arise in the genitals which are composed of [certain parts], and this is caused by many things: either by an acute, acrid superfluity which is poured into the genitals, or by a blow.
E es la color de la apostema segon la color del cos, e no es atrobat en lu dolor, e es apostema greu.	And the color of the abscess is according to the color of the body, and no pain is found in it, and it is a serious abscess.
E fort leu es apostema lapificada, del qual la color es fosca, e no es centiment a lu.	And very quickly is a lapified abscess, of which the color is dark, and there is no feeling in it.
E alcunas veguadas es fayt per nodacio de las arcerias, e per imflacio de aquelas ayssi quo ja es perceubut la rememoracio de lu, o per imflacio de venas.	And sometimes it is caused by a knotting of the arteries, and by inflammation of those, so that its remembrance is perceived, or by inflammation of the veins.
Mays aquo que es per imflacio de arcerias es conogut per la dispercio de la apostema quan compremas aquela am les tieus ditz; e no cove que aquel toques.	But that which is from inflammation of the arteries is known by the dispersion of the abscess when we press it with our fingers; and it should not be touched.
Mays aquel que es fayt per imflacio de vena no es dispergut de lu alcuna causa deves la compressio am les ditz.	But that which is caused by inflammation of a vein is not dispersed by any cause from compression with the fingers.
E ja es possible que sobre aquesta specia sia fayta seccio e sobre les autres carns; e es que tu inscida la codena dels genetius, e aprop esten le huou a las partidas desus, e extratz aquel del ciphac blanc, e deliura le suspensori dels vaysels, e ligua les, e inscideys le suspensori pus que tu deliuras aquel de tota partida de las partidas del huou.	And it is possible that an incision be made upon this kind [of abscess] and upon other flesh; and it is so that you incise the skin of the genitals, and then extend the testicle upwards, and extract it from the white sheath, and free the suspensory ligament, and ligate it, and incise the suspensory further until you free it from all parts of the scrotum.
Donc si l’huou ja es am aquelas carnadas consolida, lahoras cove que tu extraguas le huou e inscidas aquel.	Therefore, if the testicle is already consolidated with those inflamed tissues, then it is necessary that you extract the testicle and incise it.
E si es adherencia entro alcuna causa del ciphac, o entre aquo que es entre les bayssels, lahoras cove que tu deliures tota aquela adherencia e inscidas aquela per inscizio redonda.	And if there is adhesion between any part of the sheath, or between that which is between the vessels, then it is necessary that you free all that adhesion and incise it with a circular incision.
Mays si es nativitat de carn en le loc de la adherencia la qual es detras, lahoras cove que tu inscidas tot aquo que es de lu, e extraguas le huou ayssi cum havem dit.	But if there is a growth of flesh in the place of the adhesion which is behind, then it is necessary that you incise all that which is there, and extract the testicle as we have said.
Donc cum es complida la tua operacio, lahoras omple la plagua de lana imfuza en oli rozat e vi; e aprop cura aquela am l’autra curacio entro que sia sanat.	Therefore, when your operation is completed, then fill the wound with wool soaked in rose oil and wine; and then treat it with other treatments until it is healed.
Capitol .lxiv.	Chapter 64.
De la curacio de hernia que es de vitz.	On the treatment of a scrotal hernia.
Vit es apostema envolut per alcuna envolucio semblant a broto am mollificacio dels testiculs, e es fayt dificil movement exercitiu e deambulacio sobre le malaute.	A hernia is an abscess enveloped by some covering similar to a boil, with softening of the testicles, and it makes movement, exercise, and walking difficult for the patient.
E en la curacio de aquesta malautia es per temor per aquo del qual es precedida rememoracio.	And in the treatment of this illness, it is necessary to be mindful of what preceded it.
Empero cove que diguam opperacio en aquela segon que fero les primiers.	However, we must describe the operation as the ancients did.
E dic que cove que fassas sezer le malaute sobre una cezelha elevada; e aprop enpelleys le suspensori dels testiculs a las partidas dejos; e aprop te la codena dels genetius am les tieus ditz am les baysels que so probdas a la vergua; e tengua aquels autre ministre que tu, e extenda aquels am extencio vehement.	And I say that you should have the patient sit on a raised stool; then gently push the suspensory of the testicles downwards; and then hold the scrotum with your fingers along with the vessels that are attached to the penis; and have another assistant hold and firmly stretch those out.
E aprop inscideys am spatum lat agut per seccio traversa en le dreyt dels vaysels entro que sian les vayssels descubertz.	And then incise with a sharp, broad lancet with a transverse cut directly over the vessels until the vessels are exposed.
E aprop excorja de tota partida ayssi quo a tu havem dit en extraccio de arceria las quals so en las templas.	And then scrape the entire area as we have instructed you in the extraction of arrowheads that are lodged in the temples.
E aprop fica en aquelas un’agulha en la qual sia fiel doble, e lia aquel en le primier del locs en les quals accideys vit, e lia aquel autra veguada en le derier de lor.	And then insert a double-threaded needle into those [vessels], and tie it first at the place where you made the incision, and tie it again at the other end.
E aprop inscideys aquels en le mieg loc per seccio dreyta segon la longuesa del cos, e extratz aquo que es agreguat de las humiditatz fetulentas e corruptas.	And then incise those [vessels] in the middle with a straight cut along the length of the body, and extract whatever is accumulated of foul and corrupt humors.
E aprop cura la plagua am curacio de las autras plaguas en las quals vols sania esser engendrada per so que caian les vaysels les quals noyreysso un de dos genetius, quar no es mal per aquo.	And then treat the wound with the same treatment as other wounds in which you desire healing to be engendered, so that the vessels which bleed from one of the two genitals may be cauterized, for this is not harmful.
Mays si accideys vit a totz les bayssels, lahoras cove que·ls testicols sian extragutz o que les testicols per aquo se cequo am les vayssels, per que sia privat de tot nutriment per la inscizio dels vayssels, e que sian estaborits, o que cequo per so que no sia juvament am aquels.	But if you cut all the vessels, then it is necessary that the testicles be removed, or that the testicles be tied off along with those vessels so that they are deprived of all nourishment by the incision of the vessels, and that they be atrophied, or that they be tied off so that there is no help for them.
Capitol .lxv.	Chapter 65.
De la cura de hernia entestinal.	Concerning the treatment of intestinal hernia.
Le adveniment de aquesta hernia es per seccio que endeve en le ciphac extendut sobre le ventre de part dels angunars del mirac del ventre, per que deysendo les budels de aquela ruptura ad alcu dels budels.	The occurrence of this hernia is due to a separation that happens in the peritoneum extended over the abdomen on the side of the inguinal rings of the abdominal wall, causing the intestines to descend through that rupture.
E aquesta ruptura es o del ciphac o de excencio de lu, e accideysso aquestas doas specias per motas causas: o percussio, o per sautz, o per clamor, o per elevacio de alcuna causa greu, o per semblantz.	And this rupture is either of the peritoneum or an extension of it, and these two types occur for many reasons: a blow, a jump, a shout, the lifting of some heavy object, or similar.
E·l senhal de aquo, quan es per extencio del ciphac, es que accideys pauc a pauc en lonc temps, e no accideys soptament, e es apostema engual entro ves le preon per so quar le ciphac comprem le budel.	And the sign of this, when it is due to an extension of the peritoneum, is that it occurs gradually over a long time, and not suddenly; and it is an inguinal swelling that extends toward the groin because the peritoneum compresses the intestine.
E le senhal de lu es quan es per seccio del ciphac, quar al comensament fa accidir dolor vehement sobtament; e es apostema divers aparent dejos la codena propdana aparent, e aquo es per eyssiment del budel, e·l cos de lu a las partidas deforo del ciphac.	And the sign of it, when it is due to a rupture of the peritoneum, is that it initially causes severe pain suddenly; and it is a different swelling appearing below the groin, and this is because of the protrusion of the intestine and its body outside the peritoneum.
E alcunas veguadas es fora-getat am le budel la tela, e es apelada aquesta hernia entestinal zirbal.	And sometimes the omentum is protruded along with the intestine, and this hernia is called an intestinal zirbal hernia.  (Note: "zirbal" is likely a transcription variant or a word specific to this dialect/text and may not have a direct modern medical equivalent.)
E alcunas veguadas es fayta am ventositat, e alcunas veguadas corr en le budel fenda, e aqui es retenguda, e es am aquo gran pernitia3 del malaute, e alcunas veguadas fa endevenir dolor malvada e majorment quan es premut.	And sometimes it is caused by flatulence, and sometimes a tear occurs in the intestine, and it is retained there, and this causes great harm to the patient, and sometimes it causes severe pain, especially when it is pressed.
E en la curacio de las especias de aquesta malautia am ferr es temor, per que cove que sia esquivat le cazament en aquela.	And in the treatment of this type of illness, using iron (i.e., cautery) is dangerous, therefore it should be avoided in this case.
E la manieyra de la operacio de aquela es que comandes al malaute que redugua le budel am la sua ma a las partidas dedintz de la sua conquavitat si obezeys al sieu retornament, e aprop sia envessat sobre le sieu col entre las tuas mas, e eleva las cambas de lu.	And the method of operating on this is that you command the patient to return the intestine with his hand to its cavity if it obeys its return, and then it should be wrapped around its neck between your hands, and raise his legs.
E aprop sten la codena la qual siec la codena dels testicols a las partidas desus, e inscideys la codena dels testicols tota per le lonc; e aprop fiqua en doas labias de la seccio uncis segon que indigeysses a hubrir la seccio am aquels.	Then hold the cord, which is the spermatic cord, upwards, and incise the spermatic cord lengthwise; and then place hooks in the two lips of the incision as you need to open the incision with them.
E si’ la seccio segon la quantitat que a tu sia possible que de aquela le huou sia foro-getat.	And if the incision, according to the amount that is possible for you, allows the testicle to be expelled from it.
E aprop excorja aquela ciphaqueth les quals so dejos la codena dels testicols, entro que sia descubert le ciphac blanc dur de quascuna partida.	Then scrape away that skin which is under the spermatic cord until the hard white tunic is uncovered on each side.
Lahoras tu entromet le tieu dit en aquo que siec le testicol, en aquo que es entre ciphac blanc, le qual es dejos la codena del huou, e entre le ciphac segon, e absolve am aquel’adherencia que es en la partida detras del huou.	Then you insert your finger into what is the testicle, into what is between the white tunic, which is under the spermatic cord, and the second tunic, and break up with it the adhesion which is in the part behind the testicle.
E aprop mau am la ma la codena dels testicols a las partidas deforo, e am aysso exten le ciphac blanc en sus am la ma sinestra, e eleva le huou am le ciphac a la partida de la seccio; e comanda al ministre que extenda le huou ensus e tu dissolveys la adherencia que es detras am solucio complida.	Then gently pull the spermatic cord upwards with your hand, and with this, stretch the white tunic upwards with your left hand, and elevate the testicle with the tunic to the edge of the incision; and instruct the assistant to pull the testicle upwards while you completely dissolve the adhesions behind with a complete solution [i.e., completely loosen or separate the adhesions].
E cerqua am les tieus ditz que lay no sia alcuna causa del budel envelopat en le ciphac blanc dur.	And check with your fingers that there is no bowel enveloped in the hard white tunic.
Mays si tu atrobas de lu alcuna causa, lahoras tu enpelleys aquel al ventre dejos.	But if you find anything there, then push it back down into the abdomen.
E aprop tu pren una agulha en la qual sia fiel gros fayt de x fiels, e entromet aquel deves le derier del ciphac, le qual es jos la codena dels testicols, la qual siec seccio; e aprop inscideys las extremitatz las quals emineysso del fiel entro que sian quatre fiels, e aprop compausa alcus de lor sobre alcuna figura en manieyra de crotz; e lia am aquel le ciphac del qual havem dit que es dejos la codena dels testicols am fort liament de dos partz.	Then take a needle on which a thick thread is made of six threads, and insert it under the back of the tunic, which is under the spermatic cord, which is the incision; and then incise the ends which emerge from the thread until there are four threads, and then arrange some of them in the form of a cross; and tie the tunic, which we have said is under the spermatic cord, with it firmly in two parts [i.e., tie it tightly in two places].
E aprop envolveys las extremitatz dels fiels e lia aquelas am liament vehement entro que alcu dels vayssels que noyrrisso aquels no puscan trametre alcuna causa per so que de aqui no accida apostema caut.	Then wrap the ends of the threads and tie them tightly so that none of the vessels nourishing them can transmit anything, so that a hot abscess does not occur from this.
E pausa autra veguada liament segon foro le primier liament, lonh de lu mens tres ditz; e aprop aquestz dos liaments layssa del ciphac le qual es dejos la codena dels testicols la quantitat de la grandeza del dit, e inscideys tot le romanent segon redondeza, e osta de lu le huou.	And place another ligature, similar to the first, at least three fingers away from it; and between these two ligatures leave of the tunic which is under the spermatic cord the amount of the size of a finger, and incise all the rest in a circular manner, and remove the testicle.
E aprop inscideys en la partida dejos de la codena dels testicols per seccio de la qual corra sanc e sania ayssi cum havem recomtat en aquo que havem dit.	Then incise in the area below the spermatic cord, through an incision from which blood and pus will flow, just as we have described above.
E aprop aministra lana submersa en oli, e pausa en la plagua; e aministra le liament le qual havem recomtat (e alcunas veguadas le ciphac blanc es cauterizat, le qual havem dit aprop la inscizio de lu temen de flux de sanc, quar motas veguadas accideys aquels) e leyssa le liament entro que per si caia.	Then apply wool soaked in oil and place it on the wound; and apply the ligature which we have described (and sometimes the white tunic is cauterized, which we have mentioned near the incision to prevent bleeding, because this often happens) and leave the ligature until it falls off by itself.
Mays si le cazement de lu es tardat, lahoras de aygua cauda sia embrocat, e pausa sobre aquel entro que caia segon que havem dit.	But if its falling off is delayed, then let it be bathed with warm water, and keep it there until it falls off as we have said.
E aprop cura la plagua am l’autra curacio de las plaguas entro que sia sanat.	Then treat the wound with the other treatments for wounds until it is healed.
Capitol .lxvi.	Chapter 66.
De hernia ventosa.	On a Windy Hernia (or,  Concerning a Windy Hernia/Ventosity)
En aquesta hernia no e vist alcu que sia estat ardit sus la curacio de lu am ferr.	In this hernia, I have not seen anyone who has been bold enough to treat it with iron.
E les primiers diyssero que es fayta ayssi cum havem recomtat en la hernia que es am vi; la qual es que tu lies les vayssels aprop la seccio sobre aquela am fecilitat de lu; e aprop secca en le mieg loc en enviro le apostema am aquo que obro aquel, entro que caian les vayssels.	And the first ones said that it is done as we have recounted in the hernia that is with blood; which is that you tie the vessels near the incision on that with the patient's consent; and then dry the area around the abscess with something that opens it, until the vessels collapse.
E cura la plagua segon que havem dit entro que sia sanada.	And cure the wound as we have said until it is healed.
Capitol .lxvii.	Chapter 67.
De la disropcio que es fayta en les anguonars.	Of the disruption that is made in the inguinal region (groin).
Alcunas veguadas endeve ruptura en les angonars ayssi cum havem dit, e emineys le loc.	Sometimes a rupture occurs in the groin as we have said, and swells the area.
E no deyssen als genetius alcuna causa dels budels al genetius; e si deyssen, aquo es pauc; e retorna s’en en totas horas.	And it does not allow the intestines any cause to descend into the genitals; and if it does, it is little; and it returns in all hours (at any time).
Mays si es prolonguat le temps am aquo, es ajustada fissura en le ciphac entro que deysenda le budel en le ciphac; e accideys aquo per la extencio del ciphac le qual es en le angonars ayssi cum havem dit, la qual causa es quar le ciphac es estendut, e aprop es mollificat e·l loc es apostemat e emineys.	But if the time is prolonged with this, a fissure is made in the inguinal canal until the intestine descends into the inguinal canal; and this happens because of the extension of the inguinal canal which is in the groin as we have said, which is caused because the inguinal canal is stretched, and then it is softened and the area is inflamed and swollen.
E la cura de lu es am cauteri ayssi quo es precedida la narracio de lu.	And its cure is with cautery, as its narration has preceded.
E alcunas veguadas es curada am ferr segon aquesta manieyra: e es que·l malaute jagua sobre le sieu dos entre las tuas mas, e aprop secca le loc de la ruptura dels apostemas emineys am seccio per la latitut segon la quantitat de tres ditz.	And sometimes it is cured with iron according to this manner: and it is that the patient lies on his back between your hands, and then dry the area of the rupture of the swollen abscesses with incision across the width according to the amount of three fingers.
E aprop strenh le ciphac blanc que es jos la codena entro que sia descubert.	And then tighten the white inguinal canal that is under the scrotum until it is uncovered (or exposed).
E aprop pren le ray e pausa aquel sobre le loc eminent del ciphac, e prem aquel al preon del ventre.	And then take the ray (presumably a surgical instrument, possibly a cautery) and place it on the prominent part of the inguinal canal, and press it towards the front of the abdomen.
E aprop cus le dos locs eminentz sobre la extremitat del ray del ciphac, e ajusta am la sutura un de aquels am l’autre.	And then sew the two prominent places on the end of the inguinal canal ray (instrument), and join one of them to the other with a suture.
E aprop extratz la extremitat del ray, e no inscidas del ciphac de tot, ni no extenda le huou, ni autra causa ayssi cum yeu te fi saber en la curacio de hernia entestinal.	And then remove the end of the ray (instrument), and do not completely incise the inguinal canal, nor extend the wound, nor anything else like that, as I will let you know in the treatment of intestinal hernia.
E aprop cura aquela am la curacio de las plaguas, e cum inscideyses les fiels, mundifica aquela e restaura la plagua entro que sia consolidada; quar le ciphac es contrayt e no es ajustada la eminencia de ruptura.	And then treat it with the treatment for wounds, and if you have incised the fibers, cleanse it and restore the wound until it is healed; because the inguinal canal is constricted and the prominence of the rupture is not aligned (or reduced).
E cauteri es milhor en aquest loc, quar es pus propda a salut.	And cauterization is better in this place, because it is closer to health (i.e., a more effective and less risky treatment).
Capitol .lxviii.	Chapter 68.
De mollificacio de la codena dels testiculs.	Concerning the softening of the swelling of the testicles.
Motas veguadas la codena dels testiculs en alcus homes es mollificada per aysso quar las carns que so entre aquela son mollificadas, e es fedat le reguardament de lu.	Many times the swelling of the testicles in some men is softened because the flesh that is between them is softened, and this hinders their proper functioning (or development).
Adonc necessari es ad aquel que es preguat en la curacio de lu que fassa jazer le malaute segon le sieu dos, e enscida tota la codena la qual es mollificada sobre la codena natural; e aprop que ajuste doas labias am la sutura.	Then it is necessary for the one who is entrusted with his care to make the patient lie on his back, and to incise all the swelling which is softened above the natural swelling; and then to adjust the two lips (of the wound) with a suture.
E si vols, cus en le comensament la superfluitat de la codena mollificada am tres cozeduras o quatre e am ferma sutura.	And if you wish, sew up at the beginning the excess of the softened swelling with three or four stitches and with a firm suture.
E aprop inscideys entre las suturas; e aprop cura per curacio de las autras plaguas entro que sia sanat e caian les fiels.	And then incise between the sutures; and then care for it with the treatment for other wounds until it is healed and the stitches fall out.
Capitol .lxix.	Chapter 69.
De castracio.	On castration.
Sapias que castratio en nostre ley es excomengada, mays per causa es legut a mi que·m remembre de lu en aquest libre; e no es necessaria la rememoracio de lu sino per doas manieyras, de las quals es la una per so que aquo sia en la sciensa del metge quan es enterroguat de aquela, que sapia la curacio de lu al qual accideys; e l’autra manieyra es que nos motas vetz havem necessitat de castracio de autras bestias per les juvamentz nostres per aquelas, ayssi cum de motos, e de bocs, e de porcs, e de semblantz a las bestias.	Know that castration is forbidden in our law, but because of this I am obliged to mention it in this book; and its mention is necessary only in two ways, one of which is so that it is within the knowledge of the physician when questioned about it, so that he knows its treatment should it occur; and the other way is that many times we have need of the castration of other animals for our benefit, such as horses, goats, pigs, and similar animals.
E donc dic que castracio es fayta en dos manieyras: o per atrissio, o per fissura a seccio.	And therefore I say that castration is done in two ways: either by abrasion, or by incision.
Mays en aquela que es fayta per atrissio, la via de la opera es que nos fassam cezer la bestia en aygua cauda entro que·ls genetius de lu sian mollificatz e sian linhitz e que pendan.	But in that which is done by abrasion, the method of operation is that we cause the animal to be bathed in warm water until its genitals are softened and relaxed and hang down.
E aprop pren aquels am la tua ma entro que sian resols e no apparescan dejos le tocament.	And then take them with your hand until they are resolved and do not appear under the touch.
Mays en castracio fayta per fissura e seccio, cove que tu tenguas la bestia e premas la codena dels testicols de lu am la ma senestra.	But in castration done by incision, it is necessary that you hold the animal and grasp the scrotum with your left hand.
E aprop lia le suspensori, e inscideys sobre quascun huou am una seccio entro que dos huous proceseysso.	And then tie the suspensory ligament, and incise over each testicle with one incision so that the two testicles are exposed.
E aprop inscideys aquels pus que auras quascu excorjat.	And then incise them after you have skinned each one.
E no leysses sobre aquels del ciphac alcuna causa, sino le ciphac subtil le qual es sobre les vazes.	And do not leave any material on those of the cyphus (likely referring to a wound or ulcer), except the fine cyphus which is on the vessels.
E aquesta manieyra de castracio es milhor la qual es fayta per atrissio, quar atrissio fort leu layssa alcuna causa dels testicols per que la bestia desira coyt.	And this method of castration is better which is done by crushing, because crushing quickly leaves no trace of the testicles, so the animal does not desire copulation.
E aprop cura la plagua entro que sia sanada.	And then treat the wound until it is healed.
Capitol .lxx.	Chapter 70.
De la cura de hermafrodozia.	On the treatment of hermaphroditism.
Hermafrodozia en les homes es segon dos manieyras: la una es quar o appar en aquo que siec l’espazi en la codena de testiculs, en aquel que es entre dos testiculs figura quar cunh de femna en la qual so pels.	Hermaphroditism in men is of two kinds: one is where there appears in the space between the testicles, that which is between the two testicles, a shape like a woman's vulva in which there is hair.
E alcunas veguadas de aquel corr urina le qual es en la codena dels testiculs.	And sometimes urine flows from that opening which is in the space between the testicles.
Mays en las femnas es una specia: e es que·l conh de la femna sobre le pentenilh es ayssi cum dos testiculs de home un pauc de tot yminiheys a la partida deforo ayssi cum le perpucii de home e dos testicols.	But in women there is one type: and it is that the vulva above the pubic bone is like two testicles of a man, somewhat smaller externally, like a man's prepuce and two testicles.
E la curacio es de tres specias: de dos dels homes e de una specia de las femnas.	And the cure is of three types: two for men and one for women.
E es que cove que tu inscidas aquelas carns ajustadas entro que efuga la emprecio de aquela, e aprop que cures aquelas am curacio de las autras plaguas.	And it is necessary that you incise those adhering flesh until the impression of it disappears, and then that you treat those with the treatment for other wounds.
E en la segonda specia dels homes de la qual yeys urina la qual es en la codena dels testiculs, no es curacio ni opperacio en lu.	And in the second type in men, from which urine flows which is in the space between the testicles, there is no cure or operation for it.
Capitol .xxi.	Chapter 21.
De lentinge e de carn eminent per causas de las femnas.	Concerning swelling and prominent flesh due to causes in women.
Lentige fort leu es ajustada sobre causas naturals entro que es etressat e es fayt leg le reguardament; e alcunas veguadas es magnificada en alcunas femnas en tant entro que es spandit ayssi cum en les homes e perve entro al coito.	A slight swelling is readily attributed to natural causes until it is pressed and examined; and sometimes it is magnified in some women to such an extent that it spreads, as in men, and extends to the genitals.
Adonc cove que tu tenguas la superfluitat de lentinge am la tua ma o am unci e inscidas.	Then you should hold the excess swelling with your hand or with a bandage and incise it.
E no ultimes en inscizio, majorment en le preon de la razit, per so que no endevengua flux de sanc.	And do not overdo the incision, especially near the root, lest a flow of blood ensue.
E aprop cura aquela am curacio de las plaguas entro que sia sanada.	And then treat it with wound treatment until it is healed.
Mays carn nascuda es carn que nays en le horrifici de la mayre entro que umple aquel, e fort leu es eyssit a las partidas deforo segon semblansa de coa (e per aquo alscus primiers appelero aquo “malautia caudada”); donc cove que nos inscidam ayssi cum inscidem lentinge, e curem aquela entro que sia sanada.	But a fleshy growth is flesh that grows in the mother's womb until it fills it, and it soon protrudes externally, resembling a tail (and for this reason some initially called this "tailed disease"); therefore, we must incise it as we incise a swelling, and treat it until it is healed.
Capitol .lxxii.	Chapter 72.
De curacio de alratica.	Concerning the treatment of gout.
Alratica es que le conh de la femna no sia perforat, o sia le trauc petit.	Gout is when the woman's vagina is not perforated, or is small.
E es o natural o accidental.	And this is either natural or accidental.
Accidental es per malautia la qual ha precedit, e aquela es fayta o per carn nada ajustada o per ciphac subtil o espes.	Accidental is due to a preceding illness, and that is caused either by improperly formed flesh or by a thin or thick septum.
E es fayt o en le preon de la mayre, o en les costatz de lu, o en le pus sobira de lu, o en le pus bas de lu, e prohibeys de cuoyt e de enprenguacio e de enfantament, e fort leu prohibeys las mestruas.	And it is formed either in the front of the mother, or on her sides, or in her upper part, or in her lower part, and it prohibits conception, pregnancy, and childbirth, and very quickly it prohibits menstruation.
E la cognicio de aquela es fayta per reguardament de la metrona, si la oppilacio es apparent, propdana; mays si no es apparent, lahoras tu cerqua aquela am les tieus ditz o am le ray.	And the diagnosis of this is made by observing the womb; if the obstruction is apparent, it is straightforward. But if it is not apparent, then you search for it with your fingers or with a probe.
Mays si oppilacio es per ciphac subtil, e es propda a las doas labias, lahoras tu coyta e disromp aquela.	But if the obstruction is due to a thin septum, and it is close to the two labia, then you cut and break it.
E es que pauses sobre las doas labias pulvils, e aprop pausa les tieus ditz indicz de amdoas las mas encemps.	And you should place powders on the two labia, and then place your index fingers of both hands inside them.
E la femna sia sobre le sieu dos, las sieuas coyssas extendudas, e aprop exten las doas labias am forsa entro que aquel ciphac subtil sia romput e la oppilacio sia uberta.	And the woman should be on her back, her thighs spread, and then forcefully spread the two labia until that thin septum is broken and the obstruction is opened.
E aprop pren lana e enbeu le4 en oli e pausa aquela sobre·l loc, e jagua am home le dia per so que·l loc inscis no sia consolidat.	And then take wool, soak it in oil, and place it on the area, and keep it moist throughout the day so that the incised area does not heal.
Mays si le ciphac es gros e espes, lahoras cove que tu inscidas aquel am spatum lat o am fuelha de mirta.	But if the septum is thick and dense, then you must incise it with a broad spatula or with a myrtle leaf.
Mays si la oppilacio es per carnada, lahoras suspen aquela am unci, e inscideys aquela.	But if the obstruction is due to fleshy growth, then lift it up with a hook, and incise it.
E sian am tu las medicinas que fan cessar flux de sanc ses mordicacio, ayssi cum ahacatia, e sanc de drago, e enses, ajustat am album de huou.	And have with you medicines that stop the flow of blood without biting, such as acacia, dragon's blood, and enses, mixed with egg white.
E aprop aministra una canulha de plom ampla per so que la plagua no sia consolidada leugierament.	And then administer a wide lead cannula so that the wound does not close up too quickly.
E tengua aquela per alcus jorns e aministra calgua de li sec.	And keep it there for some days and apply some dry lint.
E aprop sia curada am l’autra curacio de consolidacio entro que sia sanada.	And then it should be treated with the other consolidation treatment until it is healed.
E alcunas vetz accideys en la mayre nativitat de autres carns, e lahoras cove que inscidas segon aquesta manieyra.	And sometimes it happens in the birth of other fleshy growths, and then it is necessary to incise in this manner.
Mays si aysso es per apostema crancos, a l’apostema crancos le qual es en la mayre no sia fayta contrarietat am ferr en deguna manieyra.	But if this is due to a cancerous abscess, to the cancerous abscess which is in the mother [presumably, the breast or womb], no counter-irritation should be applied with iron in any way.
Capitol .lxxiii.	Chapter 73.
De la cura de emorroydas e de tayl e de botor roja que accideysso en le conh de las femnas.	Of the treatment of hemorrhoids and of a boil and red tumor that occurs in the vulva of women.
Emorroydas so apprecio dels orificis de motas venas entro que de aquelas corro mot sanc continuadament; e cum so antiquadas emorroydas e son fayts theyls.	Hemorrhoids are a swelling of the orifices of many veins, from which much blood continuously flows; and when hemorrhoids are old, they become boils.
E ja yeu he dit en la divisio las specias de aquelas e les senhals de aquelas, e diyre ayssi aquelas que recebo curacio e aquelas que no recebo curacio.	And I have already described in the division the types of these [hemorrhoids] and their symptoms, and I will say thus which ones receive treatment and which ones do not receive treatment.
Donc dic que emorroydas e theyls quan so en le preon de la mayre e no apparo al sentiment, lahoras en aquelas no sia fayta curacio am ferr.	Therefore I say that hemorrhoids and boils, when they are in the womb and do not appear externally, then in those cases, treatment should not be done with iron [i.e., cautery or surgery].
Mays aquelas las quals so en le orrifici de la mayre sobre las quals catz sentiment, so aquelas que so curadas.	But those which are at the orifice of the womb, upon which sensation falls [i.e., which are externally palpable], those are the ones that are cured.
E cove que tu metas la femna en mayso frega e aprop exten atheyl am les forfexs, o am drap aspre, e inscideys aquelas am las razitz.	And it is necessary that you place the woman in a cold bath and then excise the boil with scissors, or with a rough cloth, and incise them at their roots.
E aprop pulveriza sobre aquelas deves le fluxs del sanc de una de las polveras insciscivas ses mordicacio, ayssi cum acassia e semblant ad aquels.	And then sprinkle upon those [wounds] to staunch the flow of blood, one of the incisive powders without biting [i.e., causing further irritation], such as acacia and similar things.
E aprop enpellesca les sieus pes per una hora, e aprop pausa aquela en aygua freja.	And then bathe her feet for an hour, and then place them in cold water.
E si persevera le fluxs del sanc, lahoras fay aquela sezer en decoccio de sumat e de scorsas de milgranas e de gualas e de semblantz.	And if the flow of blood persists, then make her sit in a decoction of sumac and pomegranate bark and oak bark and similar things.
E aprop pren farina de ordi e comfiys aquela am miel e vi agre e fay emplastre am aquo sobre le dos de lu.	And then take barley flour and mix it with honey and sour wine and make a plaster with this and apply it to his back.
E si le sanc es abscindit, bo es; e sino, fay adherir am dos ventozas, e a las mamilhas ses escarificatio.	And if the blood is stopped, good; and if not, apply two cupping glasses, to the breasts without scarification.
E aprop pren lana e submergeys aquela am suc de coliandre o am suc de arnagloza o am suc de guarravier am vi pentit e fay adherir al loc; e aprop cura le loc am enguentz entro que sia sanat.	And then take wool and soak it in coriander juice or in comfrey juice or in  mallow juice with old wine and apply it to the area; and then treat the area with ointments until it is healed.
Mays athyl rog le qual es de aspre reguardament, cove que tu inscidas aquo que a tu appar de aquel segon que he dit en theyl engualment.	But if the abscess, which is of harsh appearance, requires that you incise what appears to you of it, according to what has been said in the chapter on abscesses.
E cura aquel entro que sia sanat.	And treat that until it is healed.
Capitol .lxxiv.	Chapter 74.
De perforacio de eyssedura accident en la mayre.	Concerning the perforation of a fistula occurring in the mother.
Motas specias de apostemas accideysso en la mayre, ayssi cum cranc e apostema lapident e ulceracios e adhubelat e erpetromens e fistulas emorroyas e raguarrias e thyl e autres apostemas.	Many kinds of abscesses occur in the mother, such as cancerous abscesses, stony abscesses, ulcerous abscesses,  abscesses with swelling, herpes, hemorrhoidal fistulas,  fissures, abscesses in the thighs (or similar), and other abscesses.
E yeu ja he dit aquestas malautias e las specias de aquelas e les senhals de aquelas, e las curacios de lor en la divisio.	And I have already discussed these illnesses, their types, their signs, and their cures in the previous section.
E cove que yeu digua en aquest tractat de apostema caut le qual ve en la mayre quan es dels apostemas que collegeysso sania, e si vols saber en qual manieyra se fa la opperacio de lu am ferr.	And it is necessary that I explain in this treatise the hot abscess which occurs in the mother, when it is among the abscesses that collect pus; and if you wish to know in what manner the operation is performed with iron (a cautery).
Adonc cove que tu consideres si la dolor de la apostema en le sieu comensament es aguda am percussio e flecma e febre, e vezes aquel enrogezir e si catz sobre aquel le sentiment, lahoras no·t coytes am perforacio de lu, e cura aquel am aquo que ajuda sobre la maturacio entro que cesse la acuitat dels accidentz.	Then you must consider if the pain of the abscess at its beginning is acute, with throbbing, phlegm, and fever; and if it becomes red and inflamed to the touch, then do not attempt perforation, but treat it with remedies that promote maturation until the severity of the symptoms subsides.
E lahoras cove que tu fassas cezer la femna sobre una cezelha que aia doas cezelhas; e recline sobre le sieu dos e ajusta les sieus pes a la partida pus dejos del ventre, e las sieus coyssas sian expandudas, e pausa les sieus brasses dejos les sieus denols, e lia quascus am liament ad aquo convenient.	Then you must make the woman lie down on a couch that has two supports; and recline her on her back and adjust her feet to the lower part of her abdomen, and her thighs should be spread, and place her arms under her knees, and bind each with a suitable bandage.
E aprop la matrona segua del latz dreyt e aministre le instrument am le qual es ubert le orrifici de la mayre, la forma del qual vindra en aquelas causas que·s faran aprop.	Then the midwife should stand on the right side and provide the instrument with which the opening of the womb is opened, the form of which will be described in the procedures that follow.
E cove quan vols ministrar aquest instrument que tu fiques am lo ray le preon de la mayre de la femna, e aquo que del instrument es intrat en la mayre no sia mays que·l preon de la mayre e leda le malaute.	And when you wish to apply this instrument, you should place the tip of the instrument at the neck of the woman's womb; and that which enters the womb should not exceed the neck of the womb and harm the patient.
Mays si l’estrument es major que·l preon de la mayre, lahoras cove que tu pauses pulvils sobre la textura del preon de la mayre per sso que sia prohibit l’intrament de tot instrument en le preon de la mayre.	But if the instrument is larger than the neck of the womb, then you should apply powders to the texture of the neck of the womb so that the entry of any instrument into the neck of the womb is prevented.
E cove que tu pauses le vertitge que corr en le strument del latz pus desus e que le ministre tengua le strument e revolva le vertitge entro que sia ubert le orrifici de la mayre.	And you should place the turning device that runs on the instrument on the upper side, and let the assistant hold the instrument and rotate the turning device until the opening of the womb is opened.
E cum appar la excitura, e es tocada am la ma e es leon e molh, lahoras cove que tu secces aquela deves le cap de lu am spatum lat.	And when the wound appears, and is touched by hand and is soft and wet, then you should dry that wound with a clean sponge.
E cum la sania es evacuada, lahoras cove que tu pauses en la plagua una meca submersa en oli rozat o oli vert en le qual sia alcuna stiptisitat; e pausa la calca7 en la seccio en le preon de la mayre.	And when the pus is evacuated, then you should place in the wound a piece of cloth soaked in rose oil or green oil, in which some astringent has been added; and place the compress in the section at the neck of the womb.
E pause deforo la mayre e sobre le pentenilh lana munda submersa en aygua en la qual sian bulidas malvas.	And place outside the womb and over the vulva clean wool soaked in water in which mallows have been boiled.
E aprop sia curada aprop dos dias am enguent le qual conveneys ad aquo entro que sia sanat.	And then let it be treated for about two days with an ointment which is suitable for this, until it is healed.
E alcunas veguadas es lavada la mayre e la plagua enayssi que es cristerisat am aygua e mel, e aprop am aygua en la qual es bulhida razit de liri o de aristologia longua, e aprop retorna al enguent.	And sometimes the womb and the wound are washed in such a way that it is rinsed with water and honey, and then with water in which the root of lily or of birthwort has been boiled, and then returns to the ointment.
E si la plagua es dedintz en la mayre ameguada, lahoras cove que tu sias prohibit de la curacio de lu am ferr, habantz cura aquel am aquo que havem dit en la divisio.	And if the wound is hidden inside the womb, then you must be prohibited from treating it with iron, taking care to do what we have said in the division. (The "division" likely refers to a previous section of the treatise.)
Capitol .lxxv.	Chapter 75.
A ensenhar las matronas en qual manieyre les enbrios bius sian medicatz quan yeysso segon figura no-natural.	To teach midwives in what manner living embryos should be treated when they emerge in an unnatural way. (or... when they present abnormally)
Necessaria causa es que la matrona conogua en le comensament la figura del enfantament natural per senhals de lu, e es que quan tu vezas la femna expremar a las partidas dejos e desira odorar le ayre, e sobre aquo es enleujada per aquo que sobre ela es del part, e festina le eyssiment del enbrio, lahoras sapias que aquest part es segon figura natural, e es l’eyssiment de lu sobre le sieu cap, e la segondina am aquel o suspensa o pendent del ombelic.	It is necessary that the midwife know at the beginning the form of natural childbirth by its signs, and it is that when you see the woman straining downwards and desires to smell the air, and moreover is relieved by what is above her of the birth, and hastens the emergence of the embryo, then you should know that this birth is according to natural form, and it is the emergence of the child head-first, and the afterbirth with it, either suspended or hanging from the navel.
Donc cum tu vezes aquels senhals, lahoras cove que·l ventre de lu sia compremut per so que l’embrio deysenda leugerament quar quan deyssen sobre le sieu cap, deysen a lu la segondina, e es mondada de aquelas superfluitatz am bona mondificacio.	Therefore, when you see those signs, then it is necessary that her belly be compressed so that the embryo descends easily because when it descends head-first, the afterbirth descends with it, and it is cleansed of those superfluities with a good cleansing.
Mays aquel que es otra aquest part es no-natural e no-lausable, quar quan le enbrio es eyssit sobre sos pes e·l cos de lu es eyssit devant le cap de lu e·ls pes de lu, e la ma de lu una, o al pe de lu i, o es eyssit le cap de lu e la ma de lu, o al ventre de lu, e fort leu es convertit sobre le sieu col, e semblant de las figuras de lu no-lausablas.	But that which is other than this birth is unnatural and unfavorable, for when the embryo emerges feet-first and its body is emerged before its head and feet, and one of its hands, or its foot, or its head and one hand, or its belly, and it is quickly turned on its neck—these are similar to the unfavorable presentations.
Don necessaria causa es a la matrona que sia savia e subtil en totas aquelas causas, e que·s guarde de error e de decepcio.	Therefore, it is necessary for the midwife to be wise and skillful in all these matters, and to guard against error and deception.
E yeu so mostrant tota figura de aquelas, e qual engen es en aquelas per so que sia significat per aquo e sia stat sobre aquo.	And I am showing all the forms of these, and what skill is needed in them so that it may be signified by this and be established upon this.
Quan le feyt es eyssit sobre le sieu cap per egrecio natural, e aquel es vehement sobre la femna e es fayt a lu part dificil, e vezes la vertut de lu ja debelitada, lahoras fay aquela sezer , o que las femnas tenguan lu, e evapora le conh de lu am fenugrec coyt e am olis humitz.	When the fetus has emerged head-first through natural expulsion, and this is difficult for the woman and the birth is difficult, and sometimes her strength is already weakened, then have her sit, or have the women support her, and evaporate her genitalia with cooked fenugreek and moist oils.
E aprop entrometa la metrona entre les sieus ditz espatum petit e fenda am aquel la segondina, o secce aquela am la sua ungla entro que corro aquo que es en ela de humiditat.	Then the midwife inserts a small, thin spatula between her labia and with it she tears the secundine, or she scrapes it with her fingernail until it removes the moisture within.
E preme le ventre de la femna entro que deyssenda le fet.	And press the woman's belly until the fetus descends.
Mays si no deyssen, lahoras cove que la femna sia cristirizada de mucellage de ptilli e mucellage de fenugrec am cizami.	But if it does not descend, then the woman should be given a clyster of mallow and fenugreek mucilage with anise.
E aprop comanda a lu, aprop le cristeri, que sia compremuda e fay aquela stornudar am condisi; e te la boca de lu e·l nas de lu per huna hora, quar le fet sira foro-getat tantost.	And then, during the clyster, order her to be compressed and make her sneeze with a sternutatory; and hold her mouth and nose for an hour, for the fetus will be expelled immediately.
E si las doas mas del fet so foro-getadas al comensament, lahoras cove que tu redusiscas aquelas am fecilitat petit a petit.	And if the two hands of the fetus are expelled at the beginning, then you must reduce them gently little by little.
Mays si no obezeys al intrament, lahoras pausa la femna sobre una cezelha e leva les pes de lu sus, e aprop concuceys la cezelha sobre la terra; e la femna sia tenguda que no caia deves la concussio.	But if it does not obey the introduction, then place the woman on a stool and raise her legs, and then shake the stool on the ground; and the woman should be held so that she does not fall from the shaking.
E si las mas no son dedintz tornadas e morr le fet, lahoras inscideys aquelas e extratz le romament del fet o lia le cors a la ma de lu am drap e extratz aquel am equalitat, quar aquel sira foro-getat.	And if the hands are not returned and the fetus dies, then incise them and extract the remnants of the fetus, or tie the body to its hand with a cloth and extract it gently, for it will be expelled.
De eyssiment del embrio sobre les sieus pes.	Concerning the delivery of the embryo on its feet.
Quan le fet yeys sobre les sieus pes, lahoras cove que tu impelliscas aquels en sus, e aprop convertas le fet petit, e aprop que engualhes aquel, e aprop que prenguas un pe de lu e extendas aquels petit a petit.	When the fetus is positioned on its feet, then you must push it upwards, and then gently turn the fetus, and then grasp it, and then take one of its feet and extend it little by little.
Mays cum son eyssit entro a las coyssas, lahoras tu comanda a lu que se exprema, e fay aquela extornudar am condizi, quar sira foro-getat si Deus lo vol.	But when it has entered the vulva, then you command her to strain, and make her sneeze forcefully, for it will be expelled if God wills it.
E si no es foro-getat am aquo que havem recomtat, lahoras tu retorna le fet petit a petit entro que pauses aquel segon figura natural, quar aquel sira lahoras foro-getat am leugier eyssiment.	And if it is not expelled by what we have recounted, then you return the fetus little by little until you place it in its natural position, for it will then be expelled with ease.
E si es prohibit am tot aquo que havem recomtat, lahoras pren de musellage de altea e de goma dissolvuda, e percuteys tot en le mortier per bona percussio, e aprop linieys am aquo le conh de la femna, el pus bas del ventre de lu.	And if it is prevented by everything we have recounted, then take mallow and dissolved gum, and pound everything in a mortar with good force, and then apply this to the vulva of the woman, and the lowest part of her belly.
E aprop fay aquela cezer en aygua tebeza, entro que consegua les ypocondias.	And then make her bathe in lukewarm water, up to her hypochondria (the region below the ribs).
E cum vezes que las partidas dejos de lu so lenificadas, lahoras fay a lu subfumiguacio de mirta e sub-pausa aquela a lu.	And when you see that the lower parts of her are softened, then give her a fumigation of myrtle and apply it to her.
E quan te la sub-fumiguacio per una hora, lahoras tu la fay sezer sobre una cezelha, e aprop fay aquela stornudar e extrenh la boca de lu, e levas de aquela, e prem la partida pus bassa del ventre de lu am leugiera compressio, quar le fet sira tantost foro-getat.	And when she has had the fumigation for an hour, then make her sit on a chair, and then make her sneeze and hold her mouth, and lift her up, and press the lower part of her belly with gentle compression, for the fetus will be immediately expelled.
Eyssiment del fet sobre les sieus denols e las suas mas.	Likewise [place] the fetus upon its towels and her hands.
Quan le fet eyssira segon aquesta forma, lahoras tu engenies en entrometen las suas mas petit a petit; e aprop la femna stia evessada sobre le sieu col, e les pes de lu pengo en jos, e aquelas sia jasent sobre le lieyt, e complegua las suas mas.	When the fetus comes out according to this method, then you gently introduce your hands; and then let the woman be seated on her bed, and her legs hanging down, and she lying on the bed, and filling her hands.
E aprop prem sobre le ventre de lu petit a petit, e aprop extratz aquo que es dejos les pes de lu de las aurelhas entro que sia preparada en la partida pus dejos.	And then press gently on her belly, and then extract what is under her legs from the ears until it is prepared in the lowest part.
E si le fet no es fora-getat, lahoras pren les pes de lu e mau aquels am movement vehement, e aprop prem aquo que es sobre les ypocondres petit a petit entro que le fet puege a las partidas desus.	And if the fetus is not expelled, then take her legs and move them violently, and then gently press what is above the hypochondria until the fetus rises to the upper parts.
E aprop entrometa las suas mas e engualhe le fet petit a petit, e comanda a la femna que se exprema entro que le fet sia foro-getat.	And then insert your hands and grasp the fetus little by little, and command the woman to strain until the fetus is expelled.
Eyssiment del fet latutidinalment pendent una de las suas mas.	Thus of the fetus, laterally holding one of its hands.
Sia engeniat en reduccio de la ma de lu, mays si no podes aquela reduzir, lahoras eleva la femna e fe aquela anar.	Let it be managed by reduction of the hand, but if you cannot reduce it, then raise the woman and make her walk.
E si anar no pot, lahoras fay la jazer sobre le lieyt, e concuteys las coyssas de lu am concussio vehement, e aprop aministra liamentz les quals yeu e recomtatz de mucillages.	And if she cannot walk, then make her lie on the bed, and shake her hips with violent shaking, and then administer pessaries which I have recommended made of mucilage.
E si es vengut le enfantament, lahoras fay aquela sezer sobre cezelha, e aprop studia sobre la reduccio de la ma, e enguala le fet segon figura natural, e fay stornudar la femna e comanda a lu que comprema a si entro que sia foro-getat.	And if childbirth has occurred, then make her sit on a stool, and then work on the reduction of the hand, and grasp the fetus according to its natural form, and make the woman sneeze and command her to strain herself until it is expelled.
Eyssiment del fet sobre·l col expandudas las suas mas e la fassia de lu es al dos de la sua mayre.	Thus of the fetus, over the neck, its hands spread out, and its face is towards its mother.
Cove que la matrona tengua la ma del fet e aprop revolva aquel petit a petit, e eque aquel am facilitat.	Let the midwife hold the hand of the fetus and then gently turn it, and let it come out easily.
E cum es e quant so es engualhat, e lahoras pausa sobre le conh de lu aquo que havem recomtat de oli e de mucellages.	And when it is grasped, then place on its neck that which we have recommended of oil and mucilages.
E aprop comandas a lu que·s maugua petit a petit, e quan auras feyt aquo, lahoras fay aquela cezer sobre una cezelha e comanda li que sia inclinada sobre le latz dreyt, e aprop comanda a lu que sia compremuda; e fay aquela stornudar am condizi.	And then instruct her to cough gently, and when you have done this, then make her sit on a stool and instruct her to lean on her right side, and then instruct her to strain; and make her sneeze with a suitable [remedy/method].
Exitus foetus praeparati super latus.	The prepared fetus exits sideways.
Quan deyssen a horrifici de la mayre segon aquesta manieyra, considera, e lahoras tu inscideys la segondina am la tua ungla entro que sia evacuada de la humiditat.	When the mother's suffering lessens in this manner, observe, and then you incise the secundines with your fingernail until it is emptied of its moisture.
E si le fet es suspendut sobre la cara e·l col de lu, lahoras tu inscideys aquela del embelic, per so que no sia retengut e mora.	And if the fetus is suspended around its face and neck, then you incise it at the umbilicus, so that it may not be retained and die.
E aprop empelleys le fet a las partidas dedintz entro que pauses aquel segon que cove, e manda a la femna que comprema a si alcunas veguadas, e el sira fora-getat am eyssiment leugier, si Dieus o vol.	And then gently push the fetus inwards until you place it as it should be, and tell the woman to strain a few times, and it will be expelled easily, if God wills it.
Exitus geminorum aut foetuum multorum.	The birth of twins or multiple fetuses.
Sapias que gemels motas veguadas so natz, e alcunas vetz naysso tres o quatre , mays aquo es estranh e tart s’endeve; mays v so causas foro natura, e no vivo.	Know that twins are often born, and sometimes three or four, but this is rare and seldom happens; but there are reasons for this in nature, and they do not live.
E conte aquelas, ja sia que sian montiplicatz, una segondina, e son seperatz per ciphac, distingen aquels enter le liguament en l’ombilic de cascun de aquels E alcunas veguadas so foro-getatz ayssi cum es un fet per eyssiment natural leugier, e so eysitz alcunas veguadas per eyssiment no-lausabla ayssi cum havem recomtat.	And count those, even if they are multiple, as one pregnancy, and they are separated by a membrane, distinguishing them by the ligament in the umbilicus of each one. And sometimes they are expelled as if it were one fetus by easy natural birth, and sometimes they are expelled by an unfavorable birth, as we have recounted.
E si son dificils alcus de lor deves le enfantament e perveno ad aquo que havem dit de las figuras no-naturals, lahoras tu cura aquels ayssi cum havem recontat.	And if some of their births are difficult and arrive at what we have said about unnatural presentations, then you treat those as we have recounted.
E si’ la matrona subtil e fassa aquo que fa am facilitat e subtilitat, e am tarditat, e sia ingeniat segon tota figura segon que es a lu preparat de l’engen amenant a salut.	And if the midwife is skillful and does this with ease and skill, and with patience, and is resourceful according to every presentation as she is prepared for by her skill in bringing about health.
Rememoratio eius quod formatur in matrice ex embrionibus et Abortiuntur.	A remembrance of that which is formed in the womb from embryos and is aborted.
Alcunas veguadas son formatz en la mayre un, e dos, e tres, e quatre, e v, e vi, e vii, e mays x, e ja es deves mi verificat que una femna abortem ne getet vi, e una autra x totz formatz, la qual causa fo fayta per mensuracio dels glorios savis.	Sometimes one, two, three, four, five, six, seven, and even ten or more are formed in the mother, and it has been verified by me that one woman aborted and expelled six, and another ten, all formed, which fact was established by the measurement of glorious wise men.
E tot aysso cove que sia en la sciencia de la matrona quar fort leu ad aquela parve semblant de aquo, e donc opause se ad aquo am so que cove.	And all this must be in the knowledge of the midwife, because it easily appears similar to that, and therefore she must oppose it with what is necessary.
Capitol .lxxvi.	Chapter 76.
De extraccio del fet quan es mort.	On the extraction of the fetus when it is dead.
Quan tu curas le fet mort am aquo que havem dit en la divisio de la medicacio e no es defora eyssit, e tu yest forsat usar de opperacio am ma, lahoras cove que consideras si la femna es de sana vertut e no es am alcu dels accidentz per les quals sobre ela es temuda perdicio.	When you treat a dead fetus with what we have said in the division of medication and it has not yet been expelled, and you are forced to use an operation with your hand, then you must consider if the woman is of sound constitution and is not afflicted by any of the conditions which cause loss of life to be feared for her.
Lahoras cove que la femna sia envessada sobre le lieyt sobre le sieu dos, e sia le cap de lu enclinat enjos e las coyssas de lu sian elevadas.	Then the woman should be placed on the bed on her back, with her head inclined downwards and her hips elevated.
E·l ministre tengua aquela de doas partz o sia liada en le lieyt per so que·l cos de lu no se extenda deves la extraccio del fet.	And the assistant should hold her from both sides, or she should be tied to the bed so that her body does not extend during the extraction of the fetus.
E aprop tu humecta la boca de la mayre de lu am olis humitz e am mucellage de altea e de fenugrec e de semensa de li.	Then you should moisten the mother's vulva with moist oils and with mucilage of mallow, and fenugreek, and linseed.
E aprop unte la matrona la sua ma am aquels olis e mucellages, e aprop entrometa la sua ma am fecilitat en la mayre, e aprop cerque am la ma loc en le qual fique les uncis en le fet.	Then let the midwife anoint her hand with those oils and mucilages, and gently insert her hand into the mother, and then search with her hand for the place where the umbilical cord is attached to the fetus.
E locs convenient en aquo: adonc tu considera si le fet es preparat que deysenda sobre le sieu cap, e lahoras tu fique les uncis en les huels de lu, o en le col, o en la boca, o en le palat, o dejos la barba, o en la furcula de lu, o en les locs propdas de las costas, o dejos les ypocondres.	And convenient places for this: then you should consider if the fetus is positioned to descend headfirst, and then you should grasp the umbilical cord at its eyes, or at the neck, or at the mouth, or at the palate, or under the chin, or at its clavicle, or in the places near the ribs, or under the hypochondria.
Mays si le deysendiment es sobre les pes de lu, lahoras en le pentenilh, o en le mieg de las costas.	But if the descent is feet first, then at the heel, or in the middle of the back.
E cove que tengua le unci am la ma dreyta, e pausa la curvitat de lu en aquel loc le qual es entre les ditz de la ma senestra, e entrometa la ma am facilitat e fique le unci en alcu de aquels locs les quals havem ditz, entro que pervengua a la causa boyda.	And it is necessary that you hold the umbilical cord with your right hand, and place its curvature in the space between the fingers of your left hand, and gently insert your hand and grasp the umbilical cord in one of those places we have mentioned, until you reach the empty cavity.
E aprop pause e fique en la apposicio de lu un autre unci, o le tertz si es necessitat, per so que sia atraccio engual, e no sia extencio segon la sua rectetut tant solament.	Then place and apply another umbilical cord, or a third if necessary, so that there is equal traction, and there is not extension only along its straightness.
Ans sia maugut a tota partida, per so que l’eyssiment de lu sia alleujat ayssi cum es fayt en dent deves la eradicacio de lu.	Rather, it should be pulled evenly on all sides, so that its removal is eased, just as it is done with a tooth before its extraction.
E cove en lu aquo que es entre lor que la extencio sia mollificada; e si alcuna partida de lu es retenguda, lahoras cove que la matrona unte alcus sieus ditz am oli e entrometa aquels espertament e revolva am aquels aquo que es retengut.	And it is necessary in this that which is between them that the extension be softened; and if any part of it is retained, then it is necessary that the midwife lubricate some of her fingers with oil and expertly insert them and loosen that which is retained with them.
Donc si la partida del fet es fora-getada, lahoras les uncis sian permudatz entra loc le qual sia pus aut; e fay aysso entro que tot le fet sia fora-getat.	Therefore, if part of the fetus is expelled, then the umbilical cords should be moved to a higher location; and do this until the entire fetus is expelled.
Mays si la ma es eyssida denant l’autra, e no es possible reduzir aquela per la coartacio de lu, lahoras cove que drap sia envolopat sobre aquela; e aprop extratz aquela entro que tota sia fora-getada, e inscideys aquela o en la junctura de la ma o en le coyde.	But if one hand emerges before the other, and it is not possible to reduce it because of its constriction, then it is necessary that a cloth be wrapped around it; and then extract it until it is entirely expelled, and incise it either at the joint of the hand or at the elbow.
E ayssi cove que fassas en l’autra ma e en les dos pes.	And thus you should proceed with the other hand and with both feet.
Mays si le cap del fet es gran, o accideys a lu coartacio en le eyssiment, o es en le cap de lu aygua ajustada, lahoras cove que entrometa entre les ditz espatum spinos e fenda le cap e extragua la aygua, o que discroba aquel am un instrument le qual es nompnat “alundat”, la forma del qual vindra am las formas dels autres instruments en le capitol le qual es aprop aquest.	But if the head of the fetus is large, or a constriction occurs during its emergence, or there is accumulated water on its head, then it is necessary to insert between the fingers a spiny spatula and split the head and extract the water, or to break it with an instrument which is named "alundat", the form of which will be shown with the forms of the other instruments in the chapter which follows this one.
E semblantment fassa si·l fet es de gran cap per natura: e lahoras cove que inscida aquel am algematu, o que prengua aquel am alunda ayssi cum havem dit; e aprop extra les osses am les forceps.	And similarly proceed if the fetus has a naturally large head: then it is necessary to incise it with an algematu, or to grasp it with an alunda as we have said; and then extract the bones with forceps.
E si le cap es eyssit e es coartat deves la furcula, lahoras sia fendut entro que la humiditat la qual es en le pietz sia efunduda.	And if the head is out but constricted by the clavicles, then it should be split so that the fluid which is in the feet is drained.
Mays si no es complicat, ni obezeys a eyssiment, lahoras tu inscideys le cap tantost segon que a tu sira possible.	But if it is not complicated, nor resists emergence, then you should incise the head immediately as much as you can.
E si le dejos del ventre es apostemat o es en lu ydropici, lahoras cove que tu perfores aquel entro que corro la humiditat que es en lu.	And if the lower part of the abdomen is abscessed or dropsical, then you must perforate it so that the fluid within drains out.
Mays si le fet es sobre les sieus pes, lahoras la atraccio de lu es leugiera e la direccio de lu a la boca de la mayre es leugiera.	But if the fetus is feet-first, then its extraction is easy, and its passage to the mother's birth canal is easy.
Mays si es coartat deves le ventre e·l pietz, lahoras cove que tu extraguas aquel am drap le qual auras envolopat sobre la tua ma, e que fendes le ventre e·l pietz entro que corra aquo que es en aquels.	But if it is constricted around the belly and feet, then you must extract it with a cloth wrapped around your hand, and you must incise the belly and feet so that what is within them drains out.
Mays si les autres membres so ostatz e torna le cap, lahoras la metrona entrometa la ma senestra; mays si la boca de la mayre es huberta, lahoras intrometa la ma en le preon de layre, e cerque am aquela le cap, e atira aquel am les ditz entro a la boca de la mayre, e aprop entrometa en lu un unci, o dos uncis, e atire lu am aquels.	But if the other limbs are extracted and the head remains, then the midwife inserts her left hand; but if the mother's birth canal is open, then she inserts her hand into the uterus, and searches for the head with it, and pulls it with her fingers into the mother's birth canal, and then inserts one or two fingers inside, and pulls it out with them.
E si la boca de la mayre es coartada per apostema caut le qual accideys a l’u, lahoras cove que no sia trebelhat sobre lu; abantz cove lahoras aministrar efusio de causas humidas grassas.	And if the mother's birth canal is constricted by a hot abscess that harms her, then it must not be disturbed; instead, it is necessary to administer a perfusion of moist, oily substances.
E aministre emplastres; e segua le pacient en ayguas que mollifican e humectan.	And administer plasters; and bathe the patient in waters that soften and moisten.
E si le fet es sobre le sieu costat, lahoras si possible es, sia agulat: e sia aministrat aquo que havem dit en le fet viu.	And if the fetus is lying on its side, then, if possible, it should be turned: and what we have said should be administered as in the case of a living fetus.
E si aquo no es possible, lahoras sia inscidit en pessas, e sia extrayt.	And if this is not possible, then it should be incised in pieces, and extracted.
E cove que non layssas alcuna causa dedintz de la segondina.	And it is necessary that no part of the afterbirth be left inside.
E cum tu auras complida tota la tua opperacio, lahoras aministra aquo que havem dit de la curacio en les apostemas cautz les quals accideysso de la mayre.	And when you have completed all your work, then administer what we have said concerning the treatment of the hot abscesses that might occur in the mother.
E si accideys flux de sanc, lahoras deyssendas en ayguas stipticas e aministra l’autra curacio.	And if bleeding occurs, then bathe in styptic waters and administer the other treatment.
E yeu ja e vist una femna en le ventre de la qual era fet mort, e aprop sobre aquel foc autra veguada emprenhada, e aprop foc mort es le fet autre.	And I have seen a woman in whose womb was a dead fetus, and soon after that, she became pregnant again, and again the fetus died.
Accidit al u aprop lonc temps apostema en le sieu embelic; e inflat es entro que foc ubert, e comensec a getar brac.	A long time ago, an abscess occurred in his navel; and it swelled until it was opened, and it began to discharge pus.
E yeu fu appelhat a la cura de lu, e medicat a lu per lonc temps, e la plagua no es consolidada.	And I was called to his care, and I treated him for a long time, and the wound did not heal.
Adonc yeu pausegui sobre lu de alscunas causas emplastra de forta atraccio, e eyssic de lu un os, e aprop passero alcus jorns, e eyssic un autre os; e yeu fu trop meravilhat, cum en le ventre no sia os.	Then I applied plasters of strong attraction to him, and I drew out a bone, and after a few days, I drew out another bone; and I was very astonished, since there should not be bones in the abdomen.
E adonc yeu cogitegui que eran dels osses del fet mort.	And then I considered that they were bones from the dead fetus.
Donc yeu enguisigui la plagua, e extrayssi de lu motz osses , la femna existent en las sieuas milhos disposicios, e ja visquec en tal manieyra per lonc temps, correc de lu un petit de brac.	Then I cleansed the wound, and extracted many bones from it, the woman being in good condition, and she lived in this way for a long time, still discharging a little pus.
E yeu no afermegui asso esser stranh, sino quar en aquo es sciensa e ajutori ad aquo que le metge artifec am la ma per curacio aministra.	And I did not consider this to be strange, but rather because in this there is skill and help so that the skillful physician with his hands administers the cure.
De las formas dels instrumentz que so necessaris a extrayre le fet.	Of the forms of the instruments that are necessary to extract the fetus.
Forma de vertitge am la qual es uberta la mayre:	Form of incision with which the mother is opened:
Aquesta es la forma de strenhedor en le qual so engualhatz les libres, al qual engualhament sian dos virtitges en doas extremitatz de dos futz.	This is the form of a constrictor in which the edges are joined, in which joining there are two incisions at the two ends of two shafts.
May empero aquesta virtitge cove que sia pus subtil de strictori, e sia fayt o de eba o de fust de boys.	But this incision should be more subtle than the constrictor, and be made of ivory or boxwood.
E sia la latitut de quascun fust quays dos ditz e le marge de quascu amdos quays un dit, e la longitut de quascu es un palm e mig; e en le mieg loc de dos fustz so dos ajustaments de aquel meteys fustz les quals ja son fermatz, dels quals la longitut es la maytat de un palm e un pauc mes, e la latitut de quascu es quay dos ditz, o un pauc mes.	And let the width of each shaft be about two fingers, and the margin of each about one finger, and the length of each is one and a half palms; and in the middle space between the two shafts are two fastenings of the same wood, which are already fixed, of which the length is half a palm and a little more, and the width of each is about two fingers, or a little more.
E aquestz dos additamentz sian entromeses en la boca de la mayre per que sia uberta am aquels quan tu revolves las doas prescriptas virtigges.	And these two additions are inserted into the mouth of the womb so that it is opened with them when you turn the two prescribed incisions.
Forma autra semblant de aquela pus subtil e pus leugiera:	Another form similar to that one, but more subtle and lighter:
Sia fayta de fustz de eba o de boys segon la semblansa de forceps.	Let it be made of ivory or boxwood, in the likeness of forceps.
Mays empero en la extremitat de lu so dos additament ayssi cum vezes, e la longitut de aquels additament es quays un palm, e la latitut de quascu es dos ditz.	However, at its extremity are two additions, like those you see, and the length of these additions is about one palm, and the width of each is two fingers.
E cum tu vols am aquels ubrir la mayre, lahoras tu fay cezer la femna sobre le lieyt les pes pendentz, ubert aquo que es entre las coyssas de lu.	And when you wish to open the womb with them, then you make the woman lie on the bed with her legs hanging down, that which is between her thighs open.
E aprop obre la tua ma am le instrument ayssi cum fas am forfexs engualment segon la quantitat que vols de la aprecio de la boca de la mayre entro que la metrona fassa so que vols.	Then open your hand with the instrument, just as you do with scissors, according to the amount you want to widen the opening of the womb, until the woman does what you want.
La forma de vertitge la qual diysero les antics:	The form of vertigo which the ancients described:
Forma de impellent am le qual es empellit le fet:	The form of the instrument with which the fetus is expelled:
Forma de amisidat2 am le qual es conterit le cap gran	The form of the instrument with which a large head is countered (or, dealt with).  The "2" likely indicates a variant or a second type of instrument.
E es asemblat a forceps al qual so dentz en la extremitat, ayssi cum vezes, e alcunas veguadas es fayt lonc ayssi cum forceps segon aquesta forma, ayssi cum vezes, al qual so dentz ayssi cum dentz de ressegua am le qual es inscidit e conterit.	And it resembles forceps which have teeth at the end, like a saw, and sometimes it is made long like forceps, in this way, like a saw, which has teeth like the teeth of a saw with which it is incised and countered (or, dealt with).
Forma de amesidat pauc:	Form of a small instrument; or, A small instrument's form.
Forma de unci havent una spina:	The form of a hook having a spine (or point).
Forma de unci havent doas spinas:	The form of a hook having two spines (or points).
Forma de forceps a la qual so dentz de cerra am le qual le cap del fet sia conterit:	The form of forceps which has serrated teeth with which the head of the fetus is grasped (or managed).
Forma de spatum havent dos extremitatz am le qual le cap es abscindit:	The form of a spatula having two ends with which the head is severed (or cut).
Forma de dos espatums latz:	The form of two broad spatulas.
Totz aquels instrumentz so excersitatz, e quan mes so multiplicadas las specias de aquel e so preparadas deves le artifexs, quant es pus leugier a la sua opperacio e pus aut deves les homes per la sua quantitat.	All those instruments are used, and the more the types of those are multiplied and prepared by the artisans, the easier their operation is and the more valued they are by men because of their quantity (or number).
E no obres de aquels instrumentz ja sia qua sia deves tu aparalhat, quar la necessitat de aquels no es excusabla.	And do not neglect any of those instruments, whatever they may be, that are prepared for you, for the necessity of those is not excusable (or, their necessity cannot be avoided).
De extraccio de la segondina.	Of the extraction of the afterbirth.
Quan la segondina es retenguda deves le enfantament, lahoras cove que tu comandes a la malautae que retengua le sieu ale, e aprop fay aquela stornudar am condizi, e strenh la tua ma sobre la boca de lu e sobre las nars de lu, e si per aysso es defora eyssit, bo es.	When the afterbirth is retained after childbirth, then you should order the patient to hold her breath, and then make her sneeze forcefully, and press your hand over her mouth and nostrils, and if by this it is expelled, it is good.
E sino, lahoras tu pren una ola e perfora en la cuberta un trauc e pausa en aquela erbas ubrent la boca de la mayre, ayssi cum calament e ruda e anet e camamilla e scicados arabic e cassia lignea e santaurea.	And if not, then you take a pot and pierce a hole in its lid and put herbs inside it, opening the mother's mouth, such as rue, chamomile,  Arabian gum, cassia wood, and St. John's wort (or goldenrod).
Totas aquestas erbas o alcunas de lor sian submersas en aygua en la ola, e pausa aquela sobre le foc.	All these herbs, or some of them, should be submerged in water in the pot, and place that over the fire.
E aprop pausa una canula de canaviera en la boca de la mayre, e tengua aquela entro que la evapor vengua a la concavitat de la mayre.	And then place a reed cannula in the mother's mouth, and hold it there until the vapor reaches the mother's womb (or inner cavity).
E aprop fay aquela stornudar ayssi cum havem dit, e la segondina sira fora-getada am velocitat.	And then make her sneeze as we have said, and the afterbirth will be expelled quickly.
Mays si roman aprop aquesta curacio e no es eyssida, lahoras tu comanda a la matrona que submerge la sua ma sinistra en oli sizami o en micellage de altea, e aprop entrometa aquela en le conh e queresca am aquela la segondina, e cum aquela auras trobada, lahoras pren la e exten aquela pauc a pauc Mays si es annexsa en le preon de la mayre, lahoras entrometa la sua ma segon que havem recomtat, e quan aura trobat la segondina, extragua aquela petit a petit segon rectetut per so que la mayre no caja deves la atraccio vehement.	But if this treatment remains ineffective and it is not expelled, then you instruct the midwife to submerge her left hand in sesame oil or mallow poultice, and then insert it into the vagina and search for the afterbirth with it. And when it has been found, then take it and extract it little by little. But if it is attached to the womb of the mother, then she should insert her hand as we have described, and when she has found the afterbirth, extract it little by little as recommended, so that the mother does not collapse from the vehement traction.
Abantz cove que sia permudada als costatz dreyt e sinestre am facilitat.	Furthermore, it should be moved to the right and left sides easily.
E aprop sia ajustat en la quantitat de atraccio, quar ela obedira e evasira de adhirencia.	And then the amount of traction should be adjusted, for it will obey and release from adhesion.
