E ventozacio no extratz le sanc sino de las venas menudas sparssas en la carn, e per aquo no catz la vertut per aquelas, ayssi cum es cazement per fleubotomia; ni no cove que ventozacio sia fayta am foc o ses foc en alcuna malautia fayta per replecio entro que le cors tot sia evacuat.	And cupping does not extract blood except from the small veins scattered in the flesh, and therefore it does not diminish the strength through them, as it does with phlebotomy; nor should cupping be done with fire or without fire in any illness caused by repletion until the whole body is evacuated.
Mays si necessitat provoca a ventozacio per malautia o per continua, aministrem aquela en tota hora al comensament del mes e en la fi de lu, e en le mieg loc de lu e en qualque temps sia.	But if necessity calls for cupping due to illness or because it is continuous, we administer it at any time, at the beginning of the month and at the end of it, and in the middle of it, and at any time.
La qual causa es quar dels homes es en les quals es sanc multiplicat entro que indigeys de extraccio de lu per ventozacio e atroba en le sieu cap graveza e soda; e de aquels es que atroba replecio e rogor en la sua cara e en le sieu cap, e en le sieu col; e de aquels es que atroba pruziment en la sua cara e en le sieu front e tenebrositat e hebetut en les sieus huels; e de aquels que gieta le loc de la sua ventozacio; e de aquels es que le lor ris es multiplicat; e de aquels es que atroba gustament de sanc en la sua boca, o que la lengua es apostemada e escup sanc; e de aquels es que lor dormir es multiplicat, e de aquels que vetz sanc en lo dormir rogor e antics e plaguas e autras causas a lor semblantz.	The reason is that there are men in whom blood is multiplied to the point that it needs extraction through cupping, and they find heaviness and pain in their head; and those who find fullness and redness in their face, head, and neck; and those who find itching in their face and forehead, and darkness and dullness in their eyes; and those who have a throbbing in the place of their cupping; and those whose laughter is excessive; and those who find the taste of blood in their mouth, or whose tongue is ulcerated and spits blood; and those whose sleep is excessive, and those who see blood in their sleep, redness, ulcers, and sores and other similar things.
E donc quan vezes en alcuna causa de aquelas, e propriament si es en le tertz o miga del mes, lahoras comandam ventozacio esser fayta pus que so passadas del dia dos o tres horas.	Therefore, when you see any of these conditions, and especially if it is in the third or middle part of the month, then we order that cupping be done after two or three hours of the day have passed.
E juvament de ventozacio de la nuca es que quan aquela confereys a gravitat en le cap e ad aquo que es efondit als huels; mays cove que aquo sia aprop evacuacio de tot le cors.	And the benefit of cupping the nape of the neck is that when it is applied it relieves heaviness in the head and that which is settled in the eyes; but this should be done after evacuation of the whole body.
E aquesta ventoza es en le loc de fleubotomia de la cephalica.	And this cupping is in the place of phlebotomy of the cephalic vein.
E no es legut que use de lu aquel que es de frega complecio, o en le qual es catarr, quar dona ad aquel gran nocument.	And it is not advisable to use it on one who has a cold complexion, or in whom there is a catarrh, for it causes great harm to such a person.
E per aquo no cove que uso de aquela les vielhs, e en les caps dels quals so malautias frejas.	And for this reason, it is not advisable to use it on the elderly, and on those whose heads are afflicted with cold illnesses.
Mays ad aquel que sobre aquela es continuant sobre lu es fayta oblivio; e per aquo cove que tu comandes al ventozador que depause la sua ma un petit am la ventosa a las partidas dejos, temen de la generacio de oblivio.	But to the one upon whom this is continuously applied, forgetfulness is caused; and therefore you should instruct the cupper to place his hand a little below the cupping vessel, fearing the generation of forgetfulness.
Mays ventozacio de alkehel es en loc de fleubotomia de la vena fusca e de la basilica: e per aquo confereys a asma, e a la constriccio de ale e a la scissura del sturment de ale, e a tos, e a replecio.	But cupping with alkehel (likely referring to a specific type of cupping or medicinal preparation) is in the place of phlebotomy of the dark vein (vena fusca) and the basilic vein: and for this reason it benefits asthma, and the constriction of the lungs, and the rupture of a lung instrument (perhaps a reference to a lung injury or instrument), and cough, and repletion (fullness/congestion).
E cove que sia enpellida la ventoza alkehel un petit, quar si es pausada dejos, engendra debilitat en le cors e en le stomac.	And it is necessary that the alkehel cupping vessel be slightly raised, for if it is placed low, it generates weakness in the body and in the stomach.
E la ventozacio de alhagdahan confereys a las dolors accident en le cap e a obtalmia, e emigranea, e prefocacio, e a dolors en las razitz de las dentz; e es en loc de fleubotomia de la basiliqua.	And cupping with alhagdahan (another specific type of cupping or preparation) benefits accidental pains in the head and ophthalmia (eye inflammation), and migraine, and suffocation, and pains in the roots of the teeth; and it is in place of phlebotomy of the basilic vein.
E cove que comandes al ventozador que no prema la sua ma am scarificacio per que no inscida la arteria e accida fluxs de sanc.	And it is necessary that you instruct the cupper not to press his hand on the scarification, lest he injure the artery and cause a flow of blood.
E ventozacio dejos le mento comfereys a alcola en la boca, e a corrupcio de la gingiva, e a semblantz a lor de las malautias que so en la boca, e stan en loc de fleubotomia de aliheric que so en las doas labias.	And cupping below the chin benefits canker sores in the mouth, and corruption of the gums, and similar oral diseases, and is in place of phlebotomy of the alar veins (veins near the lips).
Mays la ventozacio que es fayta sobre las doas spatulas confereys a caphatan, le qual es fayt per replecio de caliditat.	But cupping that is done over the two shoulder blades benefits caphatan (likely a specific illness or symptom), which is caused by an excess of heat.
E la ventosacio de las doas partidas dedintz dels focils confereys juvament de la fleubotomia de tres venas, so es de la basilica, fusca e cephalica, quar aquela atratz le sanc de totas aquelas venas pus manudas que so en la carn, e aquelas venas menudas de las autras venas pus grossas entro que pervengua la atraccio a las tres venas.	And cupping on the two inner parts of the thighs benefits as much as phlebotomy of three veins, that is, the basilic, median cubital (likely what "fusca" refers to here, given the context), and cephalic veins, because it draws blood from all those smaller veins that are in the flesh, and those small veins from the other larger veins until the attraction reaches the three veins.
E comanda al ventozador que trop no procezesca en scarificacio, quar le loc es denudat de carn, e dejos lu so nervis e arterias.	And instruct the cupper not to proceed excessively in scarification, because the area is denuded of flesh, and underneath are nerves and arteries.
E es una ventoza am la qual es ventozat sobre alshosses e confereys a las emorroydas del cul e a las ulceracios pus dejos.	And there is a cupping glass with which one cups over the hips and it benefits hemorrhoids of the anus and deeper ulcers.
E cove que comandes al ventozador que sia gran ventoza, e que sia de eram, quar le loc indigeys de fort seccio; e fort leu so traucadas ventozas subtils e sia scarificat am scarificacio.	And it is necessary that you instruct the cupper that it be a large cupping glass, and that it be of brass, because the area requires strong suction; and thin cupping glasses are quickly broken and should be scarified with scarification.
Mays ventozas de las cambas minueysso per minuicio manifesta, quar atiran le sanc de tot le cors, e comfereysso a dolors antiquas dels ronhos e de la mayre, e de la vesica; e provocan las mestruas, e comfereysso a bothor e ademil; e stan en loc de fleubotomia de doas sophenas, e alahorcoben, e de doas cavilhas.	But cupping of the legs diminishes pain subtly, for it draws blood from the whole body, and it benefits old pains of the joints and of the womb, and of the bladder; and it provokes menstruation, and benefits swellings and edema; and it stands in place of phlebotomy of the two saphenous veins, and of the two jugular veins.
Enpero mot debelitan tot le cors e fan accidir sincopi en motz homes.	However, they greatly weaken the whole body and cause syncope in many men.
E de las ventozas alahorcoben le juvament es propda al juvament a las ventozas de doas cambas.	And of the jugular cuppings, the benefit is similar to the benefit of cuppings of the two legs.
E la qualitat de la posicio de las ventozas es que pauses la ventoza al comensament vueda e sucguas per succio temprada, e no prolongues la posicio de las ventozas, mays pausa aquelas leugierament, e reman aquelas coytadament, e que las humors venguan al loc per adveniment engual.	And the quality of the placement of the cupping glasses is that you place the cupping glass initially empty and draw by tempered suction, and do not prolong the placement of the cupping glasses, but place them lightly, and remove them carefully, so that the humors come to the place by equal admixture.
E no cesses iterar aquo e continuar entro que veja le loc ja enrojezir e inflar e que appara la rogor del sanc.	And do not cease to iterate this and continue until you see the place redden and swell and the appearance of the blood's redness.
E lahoras tu scarifiqua e itera la succio pauc a pauc, e aprop considera en la dispozicio dels cors.	And then you scarify and iterate the suction little by little, and consider the disposition of the humors.
Quar aquel home que es de tendra carn de rars pors, cove que tu le scarifiques una veguada e no pus, per que le loc no sia ulcerat.	Because that man who is of tender flesh and rare pores, it is necessary that you scarify him once and no more, lest the place be ulcerated.
E comanda al ventozador que amplifique la scarificacio e pronde un pauc, e atempre la succio am facilitat.	And command the cupper to amplify the scarification and probe a little, and temper the suction with facility.
E si en le sanc es grossitut, lahoras cove que scarifiques doas veguadas, quar en la primieyra veguada es uberta la via de subtiliacio al sanc e a la aquositat de lu.	And if the blood is thick, then it is necessary that you scarify twice, for in the first time the way of thinning is opened to the blood and its aqueous humor.
Mays en la segunda a la perscrutacio aquisida de la extraccio del sanc gros.	But in the second [scarification], to the acquired scrutiny of the extraction of thick blood.
E si le sanc es mot feculent, lahoras sia fayta scarificacio la tersa veguada per que consiegua le derier.	And if the blood is very foul, then let a third scarification be made so that it achieves the desired result.
E derierament, quan volem extrayre le sanc pauc a pauc o un petit, abasta a nos una scarificacio.	Finally, when we want to extract the blood little by little or a small amount, one scarification is enough for us.
E si volem extraccio de mot sanc, scarificam am mota scarificacio; e si nos conoyssem que·l sanc es gros, lahoras cove que scarifiquem per scarificacio preonda.	And if we want the extraction of much blood, we make many scarifications; and if we know that the blood is thick, then it is necessary that we scarify with a deep scarification.
E le terme de scarificacio en la qual es la profunditat de la codena tant solament.	And the term scarification in which there is only the depth of the [scarification] point.  (Or:  And the term "scarification" refers only to the depth of the point [of the instrument]).
E si aquel del qual la codena es grossa, dura, fusca, e les sieus pors so streytz, cove que les locs de las ventosas sian untatz lenitius, apertius resolutius; si es en temps d’estiu, ayssi cum es oli de aloen o oli de violat, o oli de amellas dossas, o oli de cemensa de coja; e si es en temps ivern, lahoras oli narci, o oli de liri, o oli de camamilla, o de sanc, e ad aquels semblantz.	And if the one whose blood is thick, dark, and viscous, and whose pores are constricted, the places for the cupping glasses should be anointed with emollient, opening, and resolving ointments; if it is in summer, such as aloe oil, violet oil, sweet almond oil, or poppy seed oil; and if it is in winter, then narcissus oil, lily oil, chamomile oil, or blood oil, and similar ones.
E si la superfluitat es grossa, freja, lahoras le oli sia amaranti, o oli de balsamita, o oli de aloen, o oli aneti, e a lor semblantz.	And if the superfluity is thick and cold, then let the oil be amaranth oil, or balsamita oil, or aloe oil, or anise oil, and similar to them.
Mays si le ventozador es de amples pors de tendra carn, lahoras cove que sia prohibit de oli, e cove que ad aquest les locs de ventozas de lor aprop la ventozacio sian lavatz am ayguaros o am aygua freja de solatrum, o am aygua de coja, o am aygua de bordolaguas, e semblantz ad aquelas.	But if the patient has large pores and tender flesh, then the use of oil should be avoided, and for such a person the areas for cupping should be washed with rose water, or cold water of nightshade, or poppy water, or borrage water, and similar things.
E aquel del qual le sanc es de mota humiditat, lava las suas ventozas am vi agre, o am aygua de mirt e sumac e semblant ad aquels.	And the one whose blood is very humid, wash his cupping areas with sour wine, or with myrtle and sumac water, and similar things.
E de aquel del qual las superfluitatz son grossas, lava las suas ventozas am vi antic, o am aygua de sansuc, que es majorana, o de decoccio de anet, o de camamilla, e a lor semblantz.	And for the one whose superfluities are thick, wash the cupping areas with old wine, or with sanzuc water (which is marjoram), or with a decoction of anise, or chamomile, and similar things.
E cove que la ventozacio sia guardada denant de banh; habantz cove que sia aministrada aprop issiment del banh per una hora o per doas, e cove que dorma aprop la ventozacio.	And the cupping should be done before a bath; however, it should be administered about an hour or two before the bath, and he should sleep after the cupping.
Quid est quo oportet ut regatur ventosandus aus phlebotomatus ante ventosationem.	What is required to regulate the patient (or perhaps, "the one to be cupped") before cupping or phlebotomy?
Cove que consideras al comensament: lahoras si le ventozador o aquel que·s deu fleubotomar es coleric e ventz sobre lu sanc agut e imflamacio, lahoras cove que prengua causas infrigidantz, ayssi cum milgranas acetosas, e endivia an vi agre e laytuguas, e secanabin, e julep, e a lor semblantz.	You should consider at the beginning: if the one to be cupped or bled is choleric, and has sharp, inflamed blood, then he should take cooling things, such as sour pomegranates, endive in sour wine, lettuce, succory, julep, and similar things.
E pausa a lor viandas ayssi cum poletz, e carns de auzels serbiges, e viandas conditas am agras, e a lu semblantz.	And give him foods such as chicken, the meat of domestic birds, and foods seasoned with acids, and similar things.
E de aquel del qual la compleccio es freja, cove que prengua en beure eyssarop almiva, o eyssarop de alsecanabin de semensas, e sumac, e vi mot odorant migier entre viel et noel; e que a lu sia comendat que use de paucitat de beure e de mangar, e pausa las viandas de lu poletz e canabir e pissers e petitz auzels e colombat.	And for one whose complexion is cold, he should drink syrup of almonds, or syrup of succory seeds, sumac, and very fragrant wine, mid-way between old and new; and he should be advised to use moderation in drinking and eating, and give him foods such as chicken, hempseed, peas, small birds, and pigeons.
E cove que en lo dia de ventozacio e de fleubotomia le beure sia major que la vianda.	And it is necessary that on the day of cupping and phlebotomy, his drink should be greater in quantity than his food.
E cove que sia donat en beure en alcunas horas ad alcus homes tyriaca alpharac, o medicamentz de musc, so es muscada, o alcelita denant la ventozacio o denant fleubotomia o aprop, per so que·ls membres principals sian confortatz e que·l sanc sia subtiliat; e no cove que prenguan aquela scalfatz.	And it should be given to drink at certain hours to some men theriac alpharac, or medicines of musk, that is, nutmeg, or theriac before cupping or before phlebotomy or afterwards, so that the principal members are strengthened and the blood is thinned; and they should not take those [medicines] hot.
Mays las ventozas que so ses scarificacio sian ventozas que so pausadas sus le fetge, e sobre la melsa e podagra, e sobre le umbelic, en les locs dels jonolhs, e la pixida del ancha, quar aquestz membres no suffertan scarificacio sobre si.	But the cuppings that are without scarification should be cuppings that are placed on the liver, and on the spleen, and on the gout, and on the navel, in the areas of the knees, and the hip joint, because these parts do not tolerate scarification on them.
E no es querit per aquelas sino atraccio de sanc de membre, ayssi cum pausam ventosa sobre mamilha en malautia de flux de sanc del sanc de las nars; e usam de aquela per que sia dissolvuda ventositat freja inviscade del membre, ayssi cum pausam sobre le ventre e l’umbelic; quar aquela rarifique le membre e scalfa lu e ramau la dolor quar resolveys ventositat.	And it is not desired for those [cuppings] except the drawing of blood from a member, just as we place a cupping glass on the breast in the illness of a blood flow from the nose; and we use this so that cold, hidden flatulence is dissolved from the member, just as we place it on the belly and the navel; for this rarefies the member and warms it and diminishes the pain because it resolves flatulence.
E ja es pausada sobre les ronhos quan accideys en lor opilacio o poyra, quar per vertut de atraccio fort leu huobre opilacio e erradica le poyra de son loc.	And it is placed on boils when they occur with obstruction or pus, for by the virtue of strong attraction it quickly opens the obstruction and removes the pus from its place.
E semblantment fa quan es pausada sobre le fetge e la melsa deves ventositat en aquels enclausa.	And similarly it acts when it is placed on the liver and spleen because of enclosed flatulence in them.
E aquestas ventozas so administradas vuedas amb succio tant solament; e alcunas veguadas so administradas am foc.	And these cuppings are administered empty with suction only; and sometimes they are administered with fire.
E alcunas veguadas so administradas plenas de aygua tebeza en las malautias de la melsa.	And sometimes they are administered full of lukewarm water in illnesses of the spleen.
E aquo es per que la ventoza sia umplida e sia pus gran, so es aygua cauda sola o aygua en la qual sian cuytas herbas ad aquo convenientz.	And this is so that the cupping glass is filled and is larger; that is, with hot water alone or water in which herbs suitable for this are boiled.
Forma de ventoza aministrada am foc: sia la amplitud del orrifici de dos ditz, segon que nos la havem formada; e la quantitat del preon sia la maytat de un palm; e sia en lo latz de lu, en le loc que es en le circuit, la maytat de lu, le trauc sia petit segon la quantitat que intre en lu una agulha.	Method of cupping administered with fire: let the width of the opening be two fingers, according to how we have formed it; and the length of the horn should be half a palm; and let it be on the side of it, in the place that is in the circumference, half of it; the hole should be small enough for a needle to enter it.
Sia fayta de eram rog o citri, de grosses marges, leon, enguals e terses per so que no leda le membre deves la sua posicio sobre lu.	Let it be made of brass, copper, or tin, with thick edges, smooth, even, and polished so that it does not injure the limb due to its placement on it.
E sia al mieg de lu vergua transversa de eram o de ferr, on es pausada candela am lo foc.	And let there be a transverse bar of brass or iron in the middle of it, on which a candle is placed with the fire.
E ja sia aquesta ventoza gran major de aquela la qual havem recomtat; e la pauca mendre de aquela segon las malautias e la etat de aquel que usa de aquela.	And let this cupping glass be larger than the one we have described; and the smaller one smaller than that, according to the illnesses and the age of the one who uses it.
E las ventosas dels efantz e extenuatz so autres que las ventozas dels joves e de grosses corssas.	And the cupping glasses for infants and thin people are different from the cupping glasses for young people and those with large bodies.
E la qualitat de pausar aquesta ventoza am foc sobre le membre es que extenda la meca am foc de lenha decentment denant una pauca candela de cera, e pausa aquela sobre le mieg de la vergua transversa en le mieg loc de la ventoza, per que le foc sia accendut enviro la partida dejos per que no sia comburit le cors del malaute.	And the way to place this cupping glass with fire on the limb is to extend the wick with a properly-sized wood fire in front of a small wax candle, and place that on the middle of the transverse bar in the middle of the cupping glass, so that the fire is lit around the part below, so that the patient's body is not burned.
E aprop sia pausada sobre le membre del malaute, e le dit sia sobre le trauc que havem dit, entro que quan tenem las ventozas e non indigem que osten le dit e que yesca la vapor sobre aquel trauc, lahoras la ventoza sira tantost dissolvuda.	And then it should be placed on the patient's limb, and the finger should be on the hole we have mentioned, until when we hold the cupping glasses and do not need to remove the finger and allow the vapor to escape through that hole, then the cupping glass will immediately be detached.
E prop igneys la meca segon la sua manieyra, e itera aquela si indigeyssas de aquela.	And then ignite the wick according to its manner, and repeat if you need to.
Mays en ventosa que es aministrada en la malautia de plauressi, am aygua, en la qual no ha vergua transversa ni trauc, e no es aministrada sino que sia umplida de aygua, e es pausada sobre le membre tant solament.	But in cupping, which is administered in the illness of pleurisy, with water, in which there is no transverse bar or hole, and it is not administered unless it is filled with water, and it is placed on the limb only.
E aquesta es la forma de lu: E aquesta ventoza quant plus es gran, tant es milhor, per que puya recebre gran quantitat de aygua.	And this is its form: And this cupping glass, the larger it is, the better it is, because it can receive a large quantity of water.
Capitol .xcvii.	Chapter 97.
Sanguissuguas no so administradas en motz membres sino en les membres en les quals non es possible posicio de ventosas, per la parvitat de aquels, ayssi cum le pot e gingiva e semblantz a lor; o en membre denudat de carn, ayssi cum le dit e·l nas e lors semblantz.	Leech application is not administered to many limbs, but only to those limbs where the placement of cupping glasses is not possible due to their small size, such as the finger and gum and similar; or on a limb devoid of flesh, such as the finger and nose and similar.
E la qualitat de usar de aquelas que si has trobadas sanguisugas que so en las ayguas dossas de poyredura mundas.	And the quality of using those is that you should find leeches in clean, fresh waters of a pool.
E aprop sian layssadas le dia e la nueyt en aygua dossa entro que sian famolentas, e que no romangua alcuna causa en le ventre de aquelas; e aprop sia evacuat le cors en le comensament am fleubotomia e am ventozas; e aprop fregua le membre del malaute entro que s’enrojezesca; e aprop sian pausadas sobre lu.	And then let them be left day and night in fresh water until they are hungry, and that no substance remains in their bellies; and then let the body be evacuated at the beginning with phlebotomy and with cupping; and then rub the patient's limb until it reddens; and then let them be placed upon it.
E cum son umplidas e caso.	And when they are full and fall off.
E si es possible succio del loc am ventoza, es mays derier en juvament.	And if it is possible to draw blood from the area with a cupping glass, it is more beneficial afterwards.
E sino, lahoras lava le loc am vi agre e aprop am mota aygua; e sia freguat e expremut.	And if not, then wash the area with sour wine and then with warm water; and let it be rubbed and squeezed.
E si es prolonguat le cors del sanc aprop le cazement de las sanguissuguas, e es aquo resudan, lahoras tu enfon un drap de li en aygua freja, e pausa aquel de sobre entro que sia abdida la resudacio.	And if the flow of blood is prolonged after the application of leeches, and it is oozing, then dip a cloth in cold water, and place it over the area until the oozing stops.
E si le sanc es multiplicat, lahoras polveriza sobre lu vitriol trissat, o guallas e semblantz a lor de las causas stipticas, entro que·l sanc sia abscidit; o sian pausadas sobre le loc las maytatz de favas excocicadas, e sian layssadas entro que las favas aderescan al loc, e es le sanc abscidit.	And if the bleeding is excessive, then sprinkle crushed vitriol, or gallnuts and similar styptic substances, over it until the bleeding stops; or place halves of roasted beans on the area, and leave them there until the beans adhere to the area and the bleeding stops.
E cove, si es necessaria, iteracio de sanguissuguas, quan es possible mudar aquelas.	And it is necessary, if needed, to repeat the application of leeches, when it is possible to change those already applied.
E si las sanguissuguas son prohibidas de suspenssio, lahoras sia freguat le loc am sanc recent o fique una agulha en les locs entro que yesca sanc; e aprop sian pausadas, quar aquelas quan sento alcun sanc tantost adarysso.	And if leeches are contraindicated or unavailable, then rub the area with fresh blood or prick the area with a needle until blood flows; and then apply leeches, for they immediately attach themselves when they sense blood.
E quan voles que cajan, polveriza sobre aquelas un pauc de aloen trissat, o sal, o cendre, e cazo tantost.	And when you want them to detach, sprinkle a little crushed aloe, or salt, or ash on them, and they will detach immediately.
Ayssi comensa lo prolec de la tersa partida: de restauracio.	Thus begins the prologue of the third part: On Restoration.
Aquest capitol es motas veguadas necessari en la art de medicina; e es restauracio de fractura e de dislocacio accident en les osses.	This chapter is very often necessary in the art of medicine; and it is about the restoration of fractures and accidental dislocations in the bones.
O, filh, sapiatz que jactan se de aquest capitol les fols metges e les vulguars e aquels que degun temps no reguardero les libres dels Antics ni legiro de aquels una letra.	O, son, know that foolish and common physicians boast of this chapter, those who never looked at the books of the Ancients nor read a single letter from them.
E per aquesta causa es fayt que aquesta manieyra dels scients in terra nostra es privat; e yeu no ho e obliat en aquo degun temps be de tot; e no he adhibit aquo que apres, sino per longitut de lectio dels libres dels Antics e studi sobre le entendement de aquels, entro que extrayssi la sciencia de aquels.	And for this reason, this manner of knowledge is kept private in our land; and I have never forgotten this in any way at all; and I have not acquired this except through long reading of the books of the Ancients and study to understand them, until I extracted the knowledge from them.
E aprop adirigui a experiment e studi en la longitut de la mieua vida.	And I have also dedicated myself to experimentation and study throughout my life.
E yeu ja he de aquo descrit en aquest capitol tot aquo que conte la mieua sciencia e sobre le qual es passat lo mieu experiment; pus que agui abreujat aquo a vos autres e deliuregui aquo de occupacio de elonguacio; e abreujegui aquo en la fi de abreujacio; et e monstrat aquo en la fi de declaracio; e formegui en aquo motas formas dels sturmentz que so administratz en aquel, cum es fayt per addicio de declaracio, ayssi cum he fayt en dos capitols precedentz.	And I have described in this chapter everything that my knowledge contains and on which I have experimented; since I have shortened it for you and freed it from lengthy elaboration; and I have shortened it for the sake of brevity; and I have shown it clearly; and I have shown many forms of instruments that are used in it, as is done by way of explanation, just as I did in the two preceding chapters.
Capitol primier.	Chapter One.
Summae et collectiones ex esse fracturae ossium, ex eis quarum praemissio necessaria est, antequam incipiamus rememorationem membrorum fraftorum et diversorum si uniuscuiusque.	Summary and collections on the subject of bone fractures, those which are necessary to preface before we begin the discussion of broken limbs and their various types.
Cove donc que diguam en le prohemi de aquest capitol las summas del sermo; e les capitols al entendament dels quals en le comensament es forsat le artifexs e a stacio sobre la veritat de aquels; so es vos e aquels que so promptz que sapian o aprenguan aquesta art nobla autres de vos.	Therefore, I will state in the prologue of this chapter the main points of the discourse; and the chapters on which the practitioner must initially focus and base their understanding of the truth; that is, you and those who are prepared to know or learn this noble art besides you.
E donc dic que quan accideys a alcu fractura o dislocacio o torcio o cazement, lahoras cove que tu te coytes al comensament am fleubotomia o aleyar aquel, o quascu ensemps, si no prohibeys alcuna causa, ayssi cum debelitat de vertut, o es aquel al qual accideys effant, o viel en decrepitat, o es temps de vehement calor, o de vehement freg.	And therefore I say that when a fracture, dislocation, sprain, or fall occurs, then you should initially treat it with phlebotomy or purging, or both together, if no cause forbids it, such as weakness, or if the injured person is a child, or an elderly person in a weakened state, or if the time is one of extreme heat or extreme cold.
E aprop sia content en vianda sieua de erbas frejas e de carns de auzels e de crabotz; e prohibem carns grossas e umplir si de viandas e de tota vianda que umple las venas de sanc, entro que siras segurat de apostema caut, e si no temes efusio de materia al membre.	And then let the patient be content with a diet of cool herbs and the meat of birds and rabbits; and forbid fatty meats and filling foods and any food that fills the veins with blood, until you are certain that the inflammation is reduced, and you do not fear effusion of matter to the limb.
E lahoras retorne le malaute al sieu regiment primier am le qual corr costuma de lu.	And then return the patient to their previous regimen, to which they are accustomed.
E donc cum le os trencat comensa esser restaurat, lahoras cove que·l malaute sia pascut de viandas nutritivas de nutriment mot e gros e greu en les quals sia viscositat, ayssi cum so viandas faytas de froment cueyt am aygua, e ris, e caps, e pes, e ventres de vacas, e huous, e peys fresc, e vi gros e semblants ad aquels, e am aquest regiment es fayta coagulacio de fractura pus leugierament e miels.	And so, as the broken bone begins to be restored, then the patient should be fed nutritious foods, rich and thick and heavy foods in which there is viscosity, such as foods made from wheat cooked with water, rice, heads [presumably heads of grain or similar], peas, cow stomachs, eggs, fresh fish, thick wine, and similar things. With this regimen, the consolidation of the fracture is made more easily and better.
E sapias que les osses trinquatz quan so en les homes que so en la primiera vilura e en los decrepitz, no es possible que sian continuatz e sian consolidatz segon lur natura per la exsiccacio dels membres de lor.	And know that broken bones, when they are in young people and the elderly, cannot be rejoined and consolidated according to their nature because of the desiccation of their limbs.
E son consolidatz e continuatz segon lor natura tot temps per la exsiccacio de aquels membres, e so continuatz e consolidatz aquels que so de lor en la fi de la lenitat, ayssi cum les osses dels petitz effantz.	And they are consolidated and rejoined according to their nature at all times because of the desiccation of those limbs, and those that are at the end of their youth are rejoined and consolidated, just like the bones of small children.
Mays empero natura ajusta e amnecteys sobre le os trencat de tota partida alcuna causa semblant a glut en le qual es grossitut que adhereys e strenh aquel entro que so ensemps conglutinatz e liatz ensemps, entro que venen la fi de fortitut e de fermesa, ayssi cum foc al comensament, entro que denguna causa no prohibeys aquel de las suas obres.	However, nature joins and applies to the broken bone from every part some substance similar to glue, in which there is thickness that adheres and binds it until they are together conjoined and tied together until they come to the end of strength and firmness, like fire at the beginning, until nothing prevents it from its work.
E per aquesta causa es necessari que pauses las viandas del malaute, viandas en las quals so gravitat e viscozitat e grosseza, ayssi cum havem dit.	And for this reason it is necessary that you give the patient foods in which there is heaviness, viscosity, and thickness, as we have said.
Mota diversitat de fractura segon diversitat del membre.	Many kinds of fractures according to the diversity of the limb.
E sapias que las specias de fractura son diversas segon la diversitat dels membres, quar fractura del os de la camba es diversa de la fractura del os del cap; e la fractura del os del pietz es divers de la fractura del os del dos; e semblantment totz les autres membres son diverses entre lor.	And know that the types of fracture are diverse according to the diversity of the limbs, for a fracture of the bone of the leg is different from a fracture of the bone of the head; and a fracture of the bone of the foot is different from a fracture of the bone of the arm; and similarly all the other limbs are different from one another.
E yeu venc am rememoracio de tota specia de fractura, expausada en le sieu capitol distincta del autre.	And I come with a recollection of every type of fracture, explained in its own chapter distinct from the others.
Mota diversitat de fractura en si meteyssa.	Many kinds of fractures in themselves.
E son diversificadas las specias de fractura del os en lor meteyssas; quar es fayta fractura arcuada otra aquo que accidan en lu stellas; e alcunas veguadas es fayta fractura segon la longitut del os: e so las fracturas de lu satagia e astelhas e addicios procedentz e no-procedentz, ayssi cum es fayt en la pena quan es preparada a escriure, e es fractura am plagua e disrupcio en le cap, e es fractura fissura petita.	And the types of bone fracture are diversified in themselves; for there is an arched fracture, and also those which happen in the stars; and sometimes a fracture is made according to the length of the bone: and these are the fractures of the sagitta (arrow) and stars and additions proceeding and non-proceeding, just as it is done in the quill when it is prepared for writing, and there is a fracture with a wound and disruption in the head, and there is a small fissure fracture.
E a tota specia es engen o turment propri en restauracio de lu segon que vindra rememoracio de lu distincta en les sieus locs.	And to each type belongs its own art or method in its restoration, as its recollection will be distinct in its place(s).
Mota senhal de fractura del os.	Many signs of bone fracture.
E per aquo es conoguda fractura del os: es tortuositat de lu, e de aquel eminencia e appericio de lu al sentiment, e so de lu quan compremes aquel am la tua ma.	And by this is a bone fracture known:  its crookedness, and the prominence and appearance of it to the touch, and also when we grasp it with the hand.
E donc quan no es en le loc tortuositat apparent ni so no es feyt deves le tieu tocament quan toques le os am agitacio e le malaute no atroba gran dolor, lahoras no es aqui fractura.	And therefore, when there is no apparent crookedness in the place, nor is this made evident by your touch when you touch the bone with agitation, and the patient does not find great pain, then there is no fracture here.
Habantz es possible que sia tortuositat o petita fissura, adon no cove que tu mauguas aquel am la tua ma e am compressio de tot; habantz pausa sobre lu de las medicinas de las quals ve rememoracio aprop aquel moment le qual conveneys al loc; e aprop sia streyt per strictura subtil.	Perhaps there is a crookedness or small fissure; however, you should not move it with your hand and with total compression; rather, place upon it those medicines of which mention is made near that time which is suitable for the place; and then it should be tightened with a subtle bandage.
E sapias que·l loc quan es arcuat e no es scindit en dos o otra aquo que no accidan en lu satagie, cum es remauguda tota partida de la sua compar, lahoras cove que comenses de la tua hora a rectificacio de lu habantz que a lu accida apostema caut.	And know that if the place is arched and is not split in two, or something else does not happen to it in that place, as is observed in any part of its comparison, then you must begin at your hour the rectification of it before an abscess forms there.
E si a lu accida apostema caut, lahoras layssa aquel per alcus dias entro que cesse le apostema; e aprop engualha aquel segon quascuna manieyra que podes de levitat e de engen.	And if a hot abscess forms there, then leave it for a few days until the abscess subsides; and then dress it according to any method you can, gently and skillfully.
E sapias que restauracio de lu e agulacio de lu es pus leugiera que del os en le qual accideysso sathagie.	And know that the restoration and healing of it is easier than of a bone in which a similar injury has occurred.
E aprop strenh aquel segon que vindra la rememoracio de lu.	And then bind it as the instructions will dictate.
Mays si en le os so satagias, lahoras es necessaria extencio de aquest membre trencat de doas partz, si es la ma o le pe; o am la tua ma si le membre es petit; o am doas cordas o am una corda e la ma.	But if the bone is injured, then extension of that broken limb from two sides is necessary, if it is the hand or foot; or with your hand if the limb is small; or with two cords or with one cord and your hand.
E sia la tua posicio am la qual pauses le membre loc engual segon la sua figura natural, mentre que las partidas so extandudas del membre trenquat, lahoras te perforsa que fassas retornar aquelas addicios am engen e segon quascuna manieyra que poyras en lor locs.	And be in a position where you can place the limb in a dressing according to its natural shape; while the broken parts of the limb are extended, then you must force those additions back into place with skill and by any method you can.
E guarda te segon la tua forssa que no accida sobre le malaute per la tua operacio delor ni lesio; e perforsa te segon le tieu poder que tu appliques la un os am l’autre son companho segon lors milhors formas.	And take care, according to your strength, that you do not cause the patient pain or injury through your operation; and force yourself, according to your ability, to apply one bone to its companion, according to their best fit.
E cove que en aquela hora aprofitablament tu toques am la tua ma aquel, e si vezes aqui alcuna causa diversa, rectifiqua aquel e enguala aquel per la quantitat de la tua vertut.	And it is necessary that at that time you skillfully touch that with your hand, and if you see anything amiss, rectify it and adjust it to the extent of your ability.
E exquiva vehement extenssio e compressio, ayssi cum fan mots fols metges que motas veguadas fan accidir apostema caut per la sua operacio, o fan accidir contraccio en le membre ayssi cum havem vist aquo per la operacio de lor motas veguadas.	And avoid vehement extension and compression, as many foolish physicians do, who often cause hot abscesses through their operation, or cause contraction in the limb, as we have seen happen through their operations many times.
E aprop annecteys, aprop equacio e decent operacio e strictura de aquel membre, e repaus e tranquilitat; amoneste le malaute sobre aquo e fay le squivar que no maugua aquel en la hora de las suas vigilias e del sieu dormir, e ves la sua revolucio e agitacio, e deves la sua egestio, e deves totz les sieus movementz am tota la sua vertut; e aguarda se que la posicio del membre sia posicio am la qual sia asegurada la dolor, la qual causa es quar quan sent en la disposicio de la posicio del membre delor o lesio; lahoras cove que permutes aquel ad autra disposicio de aquela am la qual non senta dolor; e guarda am aquo que la posicio de lu aquela sia dreyta e engual, per so que al membre non accida tortuositat quan es restaurat.	Then apply proper equalization and decent operation and binding of that limb, and rest and tranquility; admonish the patient about this and make him avoid injuring it during his waking hours and sleep, and watch his turning and agitation, and his defecation, and all his movements with all your skill; and see that the position of the limb is one in which pain is relieved, which is because when he feels pain or injury from the arrangement of the limb, then it is necessary to change it to another arrangement in which he feels no pain; and ensure with this that its position is straight and even, so that the limb does not suffer torsion when it is restored.
E la qualitat de la strictura del membre tranquat es aquela que yeu recomti; per que sapias que·ls membres trencatz so diversificatz en lor parvitat e en lor grandeza e en la forma de aquels.	And the quality of the binding of the calmed limb is that which I recommend; so that you know that broken limbs are diversified in their smallness and in their largeness and in their form.
E de aquels que son petits ayssi cum le bras e·l dit e·l focil e semblantz ad aquels, lahoras cove que la envolucio sia de drap mol subtil.	And for those that are small, such as the arm and the finger and the wrist and similar to those, then it is necessary that the wrapping be of very fine soft cloth.
Mays aquels que so grosses ayssi cum la cuoyssa o la camba, cove que en aquels sia envolucio lada e dura, quar la liadura lada connecteys le membre gran e strenh aquel de tota part am strictura engual, enayssi que en lu no intre macula.	But those that are large, such as the thigh or the leg, it is necessary that in those there be a wide and firm wrapping, because the wide binding connects the large limb and binds it on all sides with even pressure, so that no blemish enters it.
E aprop comensa, aprop la tua evacuacio de equacio, pausar liament convenient ad aquo, sobre le loc de aquela fractura am tres envolucios o quatre segon que·l membre mereys; e strenh la tua ma un petit am le liament.	Then begin, after your equalization evacuation, to place a bandage suitable for this, over the place of that fracture with three or four wrappings, according to what the limb requires; and tighten your hand a little with the bandage.
E aprop ve am aquel a la partida pus sobirana del loc de la fractura, e strenh mens que no foc la tua strictura am la qual has strengut le loc de la fractura.	And then come with that to the highest part of the place of the fracture, and tighten less than you did your binding with which you bound the place of the fracture.
E aprop elongua te am envolucio del loc de la fractura un pauc, e mollifiqua la strictura petit a petit, entro que prenguas del loc sa una gran partida.	And then extend yourself with a wrapping of the place of the fracture a little, and soften the binding little by little, until you take from the place a large part of it.
E aprop pren una autra benda e envolveys aquela autra veguada sobre le loc trenquat am envolucio, e aprop ve am las envolucios a la partida pus dejos de la fractura; e sia la tua operacio en la strictura de la envolucio e en mollificacio de aquela segon que havem dit en la envolucio primieyra desus.	And then take another bandage and wrap it again over the broken place with a wrapping, and then come with the wrappings to the lower part of the fracture; and let your operation be in the tightening of the wrapping and in the softening of it according to what we have said in the first wrapping above.
E aprop pausa entre las volucios de stopa leon o drap am le qual sia engualada la tortuositat de la fractura, si en lu es tortuositat; e sino, no pauses en lu alcuna causa.	And then place between the layers of bandage, linen or cloth with which the crookedness of the fracture is padded, if there is crookedness in it; and if not, place nothing there.
E aprop pausa sobre lu autra benda, e aprop enguala sobre aquestas envolucios stelhas decentment faytas tantost, si en le loc no es imflacio o apostema caut, e lahoras pausa sobre lu aquo que sede le apostema aquel e que oste la imflacio; e layssa aquela per alcus jorns; e lahoras tu strenh sobre lu las stelhas.	And then place another bandage over it, and then wrap over these bandages well-made splints immediately, if in the place there is no inflammation or hot abscess, and then place over it that which dries the abscess and which removes the inflammation; and leave that for some days; and then you tighten the splints over it.
E sian las stelhas de la maytat de canna lada raza, e be formada saviament; o sian de fust de pi; o de ramps de palma ; e sia le ample de quascuna stelha segon aquesta forma e aquesta figura:	And let the splints be of half a cane, smooth and well-formed wisely; or let them be of pine wood; or of palm branches; and let the width of each splint be according to this form and this figure:
Empero cove que la astelha que es pausada sobre aquela fractura sia pus grossa e pus lada un petit que las autras astelhas, e la longitut de la stela segon qu’es legut al membre en magnitut e parvitat; e aprop strenh sobre las astelhas am autra benda segon la tua primieyra strictura; e aprop lia desus am fiel decentment segon que havem dit de strictura, e es que sia la tua strictura segon le loc de la fractura mes, e quant mes es alonguat de la fractura, es mendre la strictura.	However, it is necessary that the splint which is placed over the fracture be thicker and a little smoother than the other splints, and the length of the splint according to what is required for the limb in size and smallness; and then tighten over the splints with another bandage according to your first tightening; and then bind over it with thread decently as we have said of tightening, and it is that your tightening be according to the location of the fracture, the more it is distanced from the fracture, the less the tightening.
E cove que les fils sian migiers en grossesa e subtilitat, e sian de li mol; e si les fils so grosses, ayssi cum yeu he vist per la operacio de alcus fols pausantz les lors fils de cordas de li tort, e es error gran, quan catz la strictura fora equalitat.	And it is necessary that the threads be moderate in thickness and fineness, and be of linen; and if the threads are thick, as I have seen in the operation of some fools placing their threads of twisted ropes, and it is a great error when the tightening falls out of equality.
E eyssament fils subtils no so convenientz, quar tu no consaguiras per strictura am aquels aquo que voles, e no cove que entre astela e astela haja mens de un dit.	And likewise, very fine threads are not convenient, because you will not achieve with those what you want through tightening, and it is not necessary that there be less than a finger's width between splint and splint.
E si le malaute es ledit per las extremitatz de las stelas aprop la strictura en les locs sas, lahoras pausa dejos aquelas de stopa leon o lana carmenada entro que aquo no li fassa lesio.	And if the patient is harmed by the ends of the splints near the binding in those places, then place under those some carded flax or wool until that does not cause him harm.
Alcunas veguadas fractura es am plagua, e accideys disrupcio en la codena, e yeu vindre am rememoracio en aquela en le capitol segon singularitat.	Sometimes a fracture is accompanied by a wound, and a disruption occurs in the bone, and I will come to a recollection of that in the following chapter according to its singularity.
E sapias que ges tot membre trencat no es streyt am stelhas al primier dia; la qual causa es quar le membre, quan es gran, no cove que pauses sobre lu stelhas sino aprop v dias o vii o mays, segon la tua seguratat de adveniment de apostema caut.	And know that not every broken limb is bound with splints on the first day; the reason for this is that, when the limb is large, it is not necessary to place splints on it except after about five days or seven or more, according to your certainty of the occurrence of a hot abscess.
E aquesta es la manieyra dels emplaustres am les quals les Antics restauravan, les quals so pausatz sobre fractura e dislocacio e torcio.	And this is the manner of the plasters with which the Ancients restored [fractures], which are placed on fractures, dislocations, and sprains.
Manieyra de emplaustra comu abruejat de restaurament de fractura, convenient a motas compleccios e majorment a las femnas e als efantz, quar es de aquo sobre le qual no ventz calor ni freg: e es que prenguas de polvera de moli, e es la medula de la farina que pen deves le movement de la mola en las paretz del moli.	Method of a common, abbreviated plaster for the restoration of fractures, suitable for many complexions and especially for women and children, because it is something upon which neither heat nor cold prevails: and it is that you take the powder of the mill, which is the bran that hangs from the movement of the millstone on the walls of the mill.
E comfeys aquel ayssi cum es, sino que cribelles aquel am album de huou, e pausa la comfeccio de lu no-spessa ni subtil; e aprop usa de aquela.	And make it like this, except that you sift it with egg white, and apply the confection neither thick nor thin; and then use it.
Autra manieyra de emplaustre restaurant fractura e dislocacio e torcio: recipe de assafetida, de lapdanum, de acacia, de enula, e migrach, que es razit de milgraner salvage, de totz ana drac. x; de mirra e aloen ana drac. v; alochil ana drac. xx; totz sian trissatz e cribellatz e sian mesclatz am aygua alichil o am album de huou si la compleccio del malaute es scalfada; e aprop usa de aquest emplaustre, quar es de bona composicio e restaura les osses trencatz leugierament, e confereys a motz homes.	Another method of a plaster restoring fractures, dislocations, and sprains: take of asafoetida, of labdanum, of acacia, of elecampane, and megrach (which is the root of wild pomegranate), of each one dram; of myrrh and aloes, half a dram; of aloechil, two drams; let all be crushed and sifted, and mixed with aloe water or with egg white if the patient's complexion is warm; and then use this plaster, for it is of good composition and restores slightly broken bones, and it benefits many people.
Autra manieyra de emplaustre le qual comfereys a fractura e torcio: recipe migrach e met de altea blanca ana drac. x; de mirra e de aloen ana drac v; de acacia drac. vi; de bol armenic drac. .xx.	Another method of a plaster which benefits fractures and sprains: take megrach and marshmallow root, one dram each; of myrrh and aloes, half a dram each; of acacia, six drams; of Armenian bole, two drams.
Totz sian trissatz en mortier am mota contricio, e sian cribellatz, e sian comfitz am aygua o am album de huou e sia administrat.	Let all be crushed in a mortar with much pounding, and be sifted, and be mixed with water or with egg white and be administered.
Manieyra de emplaustre a juncturas e osses separatz de lors locs, e seda dolor accident en aquels e a fissuras e fractaduras: sia presa lana sutza e sia submersa en vi agre e oli cuyt e sia pausat sobre le loc.	A method for a plaster for joints and bones separated from their places, and if pain occurs in those and in fissures and fractures: let soiled wool be taken and be submerged in sour wine and cooked oil and be placed on the area.
Mays en aquest emplastre no es vertut de restauracio, de apostema caut e expelleys dolors propriament.	However, in this plaster there is no restorative virtue, rather it draws out hot abscesses and expels pain effectively.
Autra manieyra de emplastre que restaura os trancat: pren fuelas de figuier sort e fuelas de papaver salvatge; contereys tot e fay emplastre de lor.	Another method of a plaster that restores a broken bone: take fresh fig leaves and wild poppy leaves; pound everything and make a plaster from them.
Manieyra de emplastre abreujat aministrat deves la restauracio de fractura de os e quan tu voles resolucio del romanent de apostema: recipe razitz de altea, de camamilla e flors de violes, de farina de ers, de totz ana partida i; sian totz trissatz e sian cofitz am vi, si·l membre no es scalfat.	A method for a brief plaster administered for the restoration of a bone fracture and when you want resolution of the remaining abscess: take roots of marshmallow, chamomile, and violet flowers, barley flour, of each an equal part; let all be crushed and be mixed with wine, if the limb is not inflamed.
Mays si es scalfat, lahoras comfeys aquel am aygua de coliandre humit o am aygua e usa de lu.	But if it is inflamed, then mix that with moist coriander water or with water and use it.
Autra manieyra de emplastra pus fort en resolucio que aquest primier, quan accideys apostema dur deves la restauracio del membre: recipe de razitz de altea e de semensa de li, e de balaustia, e mellilot, majorana, flors de viol, de camamilla, de totz ana partida i engual; totz sian trissatz e sian cofitz am aygua de sauze o am aygua dousa o am vi, tot aquo segon la qualitat del membre e le repaus de la color de lu.	Another method for a stronger plaster in resolution than the first, when a hard abscess occurs during the restoration of a limb: take roots of marshmallow and linseed, and of pomegranate, and melilot, marjoram, violet flowers, chamomile, of each an equal part; let all be crushed and be mixed with willow water or with fresh water or with wine, all this according to the quality of the limb and the restoration of its color.
Mays Ypocras no diyssec en le sieu libre que sia pausat sobre le membre trenquat deves la restauracio de lu sino cerot fayt de cera e de oli e no autre causa; e recomtec que sia migier entre grossitut e subtilitat.	However, Hippocrates did not say in his book that it should be placed on the broken limb during its restoration except a cerate made of wax and oil and nothing else; and he recommends that it be of medium consistency between thick and thin.
Mays a Gualia es vist que sian pausatz sobre le membre trencat deves la restauracio de lu e las causas en las quals es exsiccacio am petit de caliditat so ayssi cum mirra, enses e semblantz a lor de aquelas causas que havem recomtadas.	But in Gaul it is seen that they are placed on the broken limb during its restoration, and the substances which are drying with a little heat are thus, such as myrrh, incense, and similar to those substances that we have mentioned.
Manieyra de emplastre que comfereys a lesio e dolor: recipe migat, de cezes, de pels de home inscizes o pena de auzel, e de altea, e sal, partidas enguals; sian trissatz e cribellatz e sian cofitz, e sia fayt emplastre.	Method for a plaster that relieves injury and pain: take millet, chickpea flour, shaved human hair or bird feathers, and marshmallow, and salt, in equal parts; let them be crushed and sifted and mixed, and let a plaster be made.
Mays la quantitat segon la qual cove que romangua la liadura e aprop sia disliada, es que consideres si no es accidit dolor ni pruziment ni le os es trencat no es maugut de son loc, lahoras tu no deslies de motz jorns.	But the amount of time the bandage should remain in place and when it should be loosened is that you consider whether no pain or itching has occurred, and if the bone is not broken or moved from its place, then you should not loosen it for many days.
E si accideys al loc dolor vehement o prusiment o imflacio, lahoras tu te coyte o deslie aquel en la hora, e osta le emplastre de lu.	And if at the location there is intense pain or itching or inflammation, then you should carefully loosen or untie it at that time, and remove the plaster from it.
E pren drap de li e spongia marina leon humida, e submergeys aquela en aygua tebeza, e am aquela lava le loc entro que cesse aquel pruziment e la dolor sia sedada; e aprop layssa repausar le membre per una hora; e aprop pausa sobre lu lana sutza submersa en vi agre e oli o oli rozat, e lia sobre lu per una nuoyt entro que sias segur de apostema caut, e que repause la imflacio del membre, e sia remauguda la dolor de lu.	And take linen cloth and a moist sea sponge, and submerge it in lukewarm water, and with this wash the area until the itching ceases and the pain is calmed; and then allow the limb to rest for an hour; and then place on it soiled wool submerged in sour wine and oil or rose oil, and bind it on for a night until you are certain of a hot abscess, and that the inflammation of the limb subsides, and its pain is lessened.
E aprop itera aquela strictura subtil e emplastre petit e no·l strenhas per la tua constriccio primieyra, e subtilia am aquel entro que sia sanat.	And then repeat that subtle constriction and small plaster and do not tighten it with your first constriction, but refine it with that until it is healed.
E si vezes que le apostema e la rogor e la dolor e la imflacio e tots les accidentz ja so remaugutz de tot, e indigeysses de emplastre e de strictura, lahoras tu itera aquel ayssi cum has fayt al comensant engualment.	And if you see that the abscess and the redness and the pain and the inflammation and all the symptoms have already subsided completely, and you need a plaster and constriction, then you repeat it as you did at the beginning, equally.
E si no accideys al membre alcuna causa de aquelas que havem ditas, lahoras no deslies aquel sino aprop tres dias o quatre o v o vii; e alcunas veguadas tot aquo es layssat per xx dias segon que a tu appar per la desliadura del membre, ayssi cum havem dit, entro que la fractura adhereys, e se acosta a la coagulacio de la carn sobre aquel.	And if there is no occurrence in the limb of any of those causes that we have mentioned, then do not loosen it until after three or four or five or seven days; and sometimes all of this is left for twenty days, depending on what appears to you upon loosening the limb, as we have said, until the fracture adheres, and approaches the coagulation of the flesh upon it.
E lahoras ajusta en la strictura mays que en la tua strictura primieyra tota, e ayusta en la engrossacio de la vianda del malaute, segon que es precedida la rememoracio de lu.	And then adjust the constriction more than in your first constriction, and adjust it to the thickening of the patient's flesh, as his recovery proceeds.
Mays si tu vezes le loc de la fractura ja desiccar e extenuar mays que no cove, lahoras sapias que·l nutriment es prohibit pervenir ad aquel; e donc embroca aquel am aygua tebeza deves tota veguada que delias aquel; e sia aquo en totz tres dias; e alleuja la strictura un petit, e per aquesta operacio corr al membre le nutriment, e es sanat leugierament.	But if you see the place of the fracture drying and thinning more than it should, then know that nourishment is prevented from reaching it; and therefore moisten it with lukewarm water every time you loosen it; and let this be done every three days; and loosen the constriction a little, and by this operation nourishment will run to the limb, and it will heal easily.
Mays aquo que fan les fols restauradors de la fractura del membre autra veguada quan no es restaurat al comensament, segon que cove, e es restaurat segon tortuositat, es error segon la operacio de lor, e temor gran, e si fos dreyturier aquo agrandit les Antics en lors libres e agueran am aquo obrat.	But what foolish restorers of a limb fracture do sometimes, when it is not set properly at the beginning, and is set crookedly, is an error according to their operation, and a great risk, and if this were correct, the Ancients would have enlarged upon it in their books and would have operated with it.
E yeu no he vist ad alcu de lor aquo far, per que es pus razonable que aquo no fassa.	And I have not seen any of them do this, wherefore it is more reasonable not to do it.
Capitol segon: De fractura quan accideys en le cap.	Chapter Two: On fractures when they occur in the head.
Las specias de fracturas son motas, e las figuras de lor son diversas, e las causas son distinctas, quar de fracturas alcuna es fayta per percussio de spaza, e la percussio osta tot le os entro al ciphac, le qual es dejos le os, ayssi cum fay ayssa en le fust, e per aquo aquesta specia es nompnada ascial; o la spaza inscideys alcuna partida del os, e inscideys la carn de lu e no passa la inscizio entro al derier de lu; e aquesta specia de fractura es nompnada levatio absoluta.	The types of fractures are many, and their forms are diverse, and the causes are distinct, for some fractures are made by the percussion of a sword, and the percussion breaks the bone entirely to the marrow, which is beneath the bone, just as an axe does in wood, and for this reason this type is called axial; or the sword cuts some part of the bone, and cuts its flesh, but the incision does not go through to the back of it; and this type of fracture is called *levatio absoluta* (complete elevation/lifting).
E la plagua de aquestas doas fracturas o es gran o pauca, e de fractura que es contricio o atricio; e causa de lu es percussio am poyra o cazement sobre peyra, e a lor semblantz.	And the wound from these two fractures is either large or small, and there is a fracture that is a contusion or abrasion; and its cause is percussion with a blunt object or a fall on a stone, and similar things.
E aquesta fractura o es penetrant que ja apropinqua al pannicol le qual es dejos le os; o es en la facia del os, e la plagua de aquestas doas fracturas o es gran o pauca.	And this fracture is either penetrating, approaching the periosteum which is beneath the bone; or it is on the surface of the bone, and the wound from these two fractures is either large or small.
E de fractura es que es ameguada en le os, en la subtilitat del cabel petita, e per aquo es nompnada aquesta specia fractura capillar.	And there is a fracture that is hidden in the bone, as small as the thinness of a hair, and for this reason this type is called a capillary fracture.
E es fractura que es fayta o per cazement o per percussio de peyra e a lu semblantz, que fa intrar alcuna lamina del os a las partidas dedintz, e es fayta en le loc concavitat ayssi cum accideys als payroles de eram quan accideys a lor percussio e es partida de lor intrada a las partidas dedintz.	And there is a fracture that is made either by a fall or by percussion with a stone and similar things, which causes some lamina of the bone to enter the inner parts, and is made in a concave place, just as happens to the sides of a ram when it receives a blow and part of it is driven into the inner parts.
E majorment es fayt aquo en les cors de osses humitz, ayssi cum so caps de efantz.	And this happens mostly in the bodies of soft bones, such as the skulls of infants.
E so a totas aquestas specias fracturas satagias, so son pessas ayssi cum stelhas separadas.	And in all these types of comminuted fractures, the pieces are like separated stars.
E yeu vindre am reremoracio de tot aquo en son loc.	And I will bring everything back to its place with repositioning.
E conoyssem totas aquestas specias de fractura per deteccio sobre aquelas e per inquisicio de lor am tentas e ostament de carn corrumpuda que es sobre lor.	And we recognize all these types of fractures by probing them and by investigating them with probes and by removing the corrupted flesh that is upon them.
E specia capillar es conoguda per aysso que es descubert sobre le os, e es abstergit, e linit sobre lu am tentha, quar la fractura appar negra.	And a hairline fracture is known because it is uncovered on the bone, and it is wiped clean, and then examined with a probe, because the fracture appears black.
Mays en la curacio de fractura considera al comensament les accidentz del malaute, e lahoras si tu vezes per los accidentz que signifique per significacio manifesta sobre paor, ayssi cum es vomit de colera, e extencio, e perdement de entendament, e abscizio de votz, e sincopi, e febre acuta, e eyssiment dels huels e rogor de aquels, e semblantz a lor dels accidentz en las majors disposicios, ses dopte no es sanat.	But in the treatment of a fracture, consider first the patient's symptoms.  And then if you see by the symptoms that it signifies by manifest signs of danger, such as vomiting of bile, prostration, loss of consciousness, loss of voice, syncope, acute fever, and sinking of the eyes and coldness of them, and similar symptoms in the most serious cases, without a doubt it is not easily healed.
E si vezes accidentz no-correntz tu speras salut, lahoras tu comensa la curacio de lu.	And if you see no serious complications, you expect recovery, then you begin its treatment.
La qual causa es quar si es vengut a tu le plaguat en le comensament cum es plaguat e aquo es en les dias de ivern, lahoras cove que tu studias en le ostament del os denant le dia xiiii segon tota disposicio.	The reason is that if the injured person has come to you at the beginning, as injured, and this is in the winter months, then you must study the setting of the bone before the fourteenth day, according to every circumstance.
E si es en les dias d’estiu, lahoras cove que te coytes ostar le os denant le vii dia, habantz que aquo que es dejos le os sia corromput del pannicol, e que accidescan les accidentz que havem recomtatz.	And if it is in the summer months, then you must endeavor to set the bone before the seventh day, before what is under the bone is corrupted by the periosteum, and before the complications that we have recounted occur.
E si la fractura ja es pervenguda al pannicol cubrent le cervel, e es am partidas menudas e atricio, lahoras cove que inscidas la partida conminuta e atrita, segon que yeu recomtare a tu.	And if the fracture has already reached the periosteum covering the brain, and is with small, splintered pieces, then you must incise the comminuted and splintered part, as I will explain to you.
E es que tu razas le cap del malaute plaguat, e descuebres sobre le os segon costuma e manieyra a tu possible segon la figura de la plagua, e que sia leugier sobre le malaute.	And it is that you shave the head of the injured patient, and uncover the bone according to custom and manner as best you can according to the nature of the injury, and that it be gentle on the patient.
E si accideys a tu deves la deteccio del os, fluxs de sanc o apostema caut, lahora tu te oppausa a lu am aquo que cove, e es que huemplas le loc de draps infuzes en vi e oli rozat, e fassa repausar la plagua entro que sia sedat le apostema, e sies segur de fluxs del sanc; e aprop comensa en la circuicio del os e en la ablatio de lu.	And if you encounter, during the uncovering of the bone, a flow of blood or a hot abscess, then you must oppose it with what is necessary, and that is to fill the area with cloths soaked in rose-colored wine and oil, and let the wound rest until the abscess is settled, and you are sure of the flow of blood; and then begin with the encircling of the bone and its removal.
E aquo sia segon una de dos manieyras de operacio.	And this should be done according to one of two methods of operation.
E la una manieyra es que tu inscidas le os am inscisori de streyt tal, e aquesta es la forma de lu: E aprop administra un autre inscissori aquest, un pauc pus lat que aquel; e aquesta es la forma de lu:	And one method is that you incise the bone with a narrow incisor, and this is its form:  And then apply another incisor like this, a little wider than that one; and this is its form:
E aprop administra mays le inscissori pus lat que·l segon.	And then apply even wider incisors than the second.
E cove que sia deves tu nombre de inscissoris diverses, dels quals alcus so pus latz que alcus autres; e alcus de lor so pus breus que·ls autres e sian en le derier de acuitat de las suas extremitatz, e sian de ferr indi o felod.	And it is necessary that you have a number of different incisors, some of which are wider than others; and some of them are shorter than others and should be sharp at the ends, and should be made of Indian iron or steel.
E usa de lor am facilitat en percussio sobre le inscissori per so que no concutesca le cap e leda aquel.	And use them with ease in percussion on the incisor so that you do not strike the head and damage it.
E si le os es fort, dur, lahoras cove que perfores en le circuit de lu denant que tu administres los inscissoris am les taravels, les quals so nomnatz taravels no-profundantz.	And if the bone is strong, hard, then it is necessary that you perforate its circumference before you apply the incisors with the drills, which are called shallow drills.
E no so nomnatz ayssi sino quar aquels no pausan le terme de l’os del test ad aquo que es aprop lu, per so quar al taravel es redonda extremitat o marge sobre aquel que es dejos le cap de lu agut semblant a marge o a cercle petit, le qual prohibeys esser submergit e passar la spissitut del os.	And they are not called so except because these do not reach the limit of the skull bone adjacent to it, because the drill has a round end or edge below its sharp head, similar to a small edge or circle, which prevents it from being submerged and passing through the thickness of the bone.
E es convenient que tu prenguas de aquestz taravels gran nombre dels quals quascu convenesca a la spicitut de quascun os, entro que sia a tu present en tottz testz del cervel la extremitat del qual sia aguda, la quantitat en longitut e brevitat sia segon la quantitat de spicitut de aquest test.	And it is convenient that you take a large number of these drills, each of which is suitable for the thickness of each bone, so that you have available for all parts of the skull a drill whose end is sharp, its length and shortness being according to the thickness of that part of the skull.
E aquesta es la forma de tres specias de teravels: La qualitat de perforar en le circuit del os trencat es que pauses le teravel sobre le os e revolvas aquel am les tieus ditz entro que sapias que l’os ja es penetrat; e aprop permuda le terevel ad autre loc, e pausa aquo que es entre tot trauc la quantitat de la grosseza del ray o enviro aquo.	And this is the form of three kinds of drills: The way to perforate the circumference of the broken bone is to place the drill on the bone and rotate it with your fingers until you know that the bone has been penetrated; then move the drill to another place, and place the holes such that the space between them is the size of the width of a finger or thereabouts.
E aprop inscideys am inscissoris aquo que es entre quascun trauc del os, e fay aquel pus subtil que podes sobre aquo en fi de levitat, ayssi cum havem dit, entro que erradiques le os, o am la tua ma, o am alcuna autra causa per alcus sturmentz les quals auras apparelhatz ad aquo, ayssi cum tanalhas e forceps subtils.	Then incise with incisors the area between each hole in the bone, and make it as thin as possible in order to remove the bone, either with your hand or with some other instrument that you will have prepared for this purpose, such as small pincers and forceps.
E cove que tu guardes am tota cautela que l’inscissori no toque alcuna causa del ciphac.	And you must take great care that the incisor does not touch anything of the brain.
E donc cum auras circuit le os perforan, e sira separat del ciphac si es continuat am lu, e auras aquel extrayt, cove que razas e enguales aquel en la asperitat de lu de aquo que es en le os am autra sturment semblant a inscissori, mays empero cove que sia pus teon e pus subtil que les autres inscissoris.	And so when you have encircled the bone by perforating it, and it is separated from the brain if it is continuous with it, and you have extracted it, you should scrape and smooth its roughness where it is attached to the bone with another instrument similar to an incisor, but it should be thinner and finer than the other incisors.
E si roman alcuna partida dels osses petitz e satagias, lahoras pren aquela am facilitat am aquo que es deves tu dels sturmentz; e aprop aquo cura la plagua am lichinis e enguentz les quals havem ditz.	And if any small and jagged pieces of bone remain, then remove them easily with the instruments you have available; and then treat the wound with liniments and ointments that we have mentioned.
E l’autra manieyra de operacio es leugiera, longinqua de paor, la qual diyssec Gualia e la lauzec per gran lausor; e aquest es le sermo de lu: necessari es a tu en le comensament que comenses descobrir la partida del os del loc en le qual es la fractura pus vehement e pus manifesta, entro que quan auras descubert aquela partida e auras pausat dejos lu la extremitat de aquest inscissori lent e alegre del qual aquesta es la forma:	And the other method of operation is easier and less frightening, which Galen described and praised highly; and this is his account: it is necessary for you at the beginning to begin by uncovering the part of the bone in the place where the fracture is most severe and most evident, until, when you have uncovered that part and placed under it the tip of that slow and sharp incisor of which this is the form:
E es que la partida lenticular es leon e no inscideys alcuna causa, e la partida aguda es de lu en dos latz avantz en longitut, ayssi cum vezes; que la partida lenticular sia ajustada al ciphac am la facia de lu inscident aguda en le os.	And it is so that the lenticular part is smooth and does not cut anything, and the sharp part is split in two lengthwise, like a pair of tongs; so that the lenticular part is applied to the brain with its surface, the sharp part cutting into the bone.
E aprop percuteys sobre le inscissori de una partida am un petit malhet entro que inscidas tot le os am facilitat ayssi cum es revolvut, e tu sias segur del pannicol que no accida en lu accident que temas en denguna manieyra, e si le medicant14 era le pus fol de totz les homes e le mays ignorant de lor; certament, e si era dorment.	And then strike the incisor on one side with a small mallet until it cuts through all the bone easily as it is rotated, and you are sure of the periosteum so that no accident befalls it in any way, even if the physician were the most foolish of all men and the most ignorant of them; certainly, and if he were sleeping.
Lahoras si romania alcuna causa annexa al os del pannicol en alcus locs de os, inscidira aquel de lu am la extremitat del inscissori aquel lenticular, e deliuraria aquel de lu am facilitat, quar es deliurat de lu ses nocument e ses paor.	Then, if any matter adhering to the bone or periosteum remains in any part of the bone, cut it away with the lenticular end of that incisor, and remove it easily, for it is removed without harm or fear.
E si fractura del os no penetra entro al pannicol, e aquo que es abscidit o es ostat del os es la facia de lu, e roman en lu asperitat e satagias subtils, lahoras cove que razas aquela asperitat e erradiques aquelas satagias am razoris subtils per les quals tu has preparat le nombre, de diversas quantitatz per que sia a tu possible administrar de aquels en tot loc les pus convenientz de lor e le pus dreyt de aquels segon aquo en que te perduzeys la tua operacio aquel os trencat e la figura de lu.	And if the fracture of the bone does not penetrate to the periosteum, and what is excised or removed from the bone is its surface, and roughness and small splinters remain, then you must scrape away that roughness and remove those splinters with fine rasps, for which you have prepared a number, of various sizes, so that it is possible for you to use in every place the most appropriate and most suitable of them according to how you proceed with your operation on that broken bone and its shape.
E cove que administres en la tua razio am la qual razes le os al comensament le pus lat de aquels razoris, e aprop usa aprop lu del pus subtil de lu, e no cesses far aquo segon continuitat entro que pervenguas ad aministrar le pus teon e·l pus subtil de totz aquels.	And you must proceed in your scraping with which you scrape the bone, beginning with the broadest of those rasps, and then use progressively the finer ones, and do not cease doing this continuously until you come to using the finest and most subtle of all of them.
Mays en quascuna de las autras fracturas petitas capillars e fractura subtil, cove que administres cura segon aquo que perduseys ad rectificacio de lu.	But in each of the other small, capillary fractures and subtle fractures, you must administer care according to how you proceed to their rectification.
E es causa que no es ameguada sobre totz les quals han studi en aquela art.	And this is a cause that is not hidden from all those who have studied this art.
E stec sobre aquo que nos scriut havem mostrat en grans fracturas.	And I stand by what we have written and shown in cases of large fractures.
E si le pannicol es retangut quan tu erradiques le os, lahoras cove que prenguas drap de li segon la quantitat de la plagua, e submergeys aquel en oli rozat, e pausa aquel sobre le orrifici de la plagua; e aprop pren autre drap doblat o triplicat e submergeys lu en vi e oli rozat e pausa aquel sobre drap prim e fay aquo al pus leugierament que podes sobre aquel, que no graves le ciphac; e aprop administra sobre aquel liament lat, e no strenhas aquel sino per quantitat que tengua la plagua tant solament.	And if the panniculus (skin and subcutaneous tissue) is retracted when you scrape the bone, then you must take linen cloth according to the size of the wound, and immerse it in rose oil, and place it over the opening of the wound; and then take another doubled or tripled cloth and immerse it in wine and rose oil and place this over the thin cloth and do this as lightly as you can, so as not to press on the wound; and then apply a broad bandage over this, and do not tighten it except enough to hold the wound in place only.
E layssa aquel am aquesta cura per un dia o per dos entro que sias segur de apostema caut; e aprop deslia aquel e aprop aministra medicinas am las quals es superflua siccitat, ayssi cum razitz de lin e farina de errs, e polvera de enses e de aristologia, e de semblantz ad aquels.
